original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par ma rtogs pa rnams dang log par rtogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba tshig dang po 'dis ni yul dang 'brel pa can dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dngos po lnga po dag bzhag ste /

translated: The first phrase, those who have not realized the selflessness of persons and phenomena and those who have wrongly realized it, presents the five topics: the connection with the object, the subject matter, the purpose, the relationship, and the actuality.

original: rab tu byed pa'i 'brel pa dang brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa rnams gdon mi za bar thog mar brjod dgos so //üîΩgzhan du na 'brel pa med pa dang / brjod par bya ba med pa dang dgos pa med pa'i rab tu byed pa ni nyan pa po rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams nyan @2a * //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i 'brel pa dang brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa rnams gdon mi za bar thog mar brjod dgos so // gzhan du na 'brel pa med pa dang / brjod par bya ba med pa dang dgos pa med pa'i rab tu byed pa ni nyan pa po rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams nyan @2a * //
translated: The connection, the subject matter, and the purpose of the treatise must be stated at the outset, without fail.

original: par khas mi len to //
analyzed: par khas mi len to //
translated: Otherwise, if the treatise has no connection, no subject matter, and no purpose, those who listen to it will not accept it, for they will be preoccupied with doubts.

original: de'i phyir nyan pa po'i skye bo spro ba bskyed pa'i don du 'di gsum brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan pa po'i skye bo spro ba bskyed pa'i don du 'di gsum brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, these three must be stated in order to encourage the audience to listen.

original: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med par zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul bstan to //
analyzed: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med par zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul bstan to //
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúthe selflessness of persons and of phenomena‚Äù teaches the subject matter.

original: ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel pa can brjod do //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel pa can brjod do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúfor those who have not understood and for those who have misunderstood‚Äù teaches the connection.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma log par zhes bya ba 'dis ni brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma log par zhes bya ba 'dis ni brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúif the selflessness of persons and of phenomena is not understood‚Äù teaches the subject matter.

original: brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni dgos pa brjod do //
analyzed: brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni dgos pa brjod do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù teaches the purpose.

original: rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams so //
translated: The Thirty Verses on Representation-Only are composed.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the connection.

original: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rigs pa dang lung gis ma log par bstan par bya ba de ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rigs pa dang lung gis ma log par bstan par bya ba de ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the non-erroneous teaching of the selflessness of persons and things by means of reasoning and scripture should be stated.

original: de rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //üîΩdgos pa de yang rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pas na /
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o // dgos pa de yang rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pas na /
translated: The understanding of that is the purpose.üîΩAnd that purpose is accomplished by this treatise,

original: rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa 'di'i thabs yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa 'di'i thabs yin te /
translated: so this treatise is the means to that purpose.

original: de'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa gnyis ni /
translated: Therefore, the treatise and the purpose are connected

original: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel to //
analyzed: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel to //
translated: by the characteristic of means and that which derives from the means.

original: gang dag la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de ma log par bstan snyam du de ltar dogs pa la /
analyzed: gang dag la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de ma log par bstan snyam du de ltar dogs pa la /
translated: For those who doubt that the selflessness of persons and things is taught in this treatise,

original: ma rtogs pa dang / log par rtogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba 'di smras so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa dang / log par rtogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba 'di smras so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúfor those who have not understood and those who have understood it wrongly.‚ÄùüîΩWhat is it that they have not understood or understood wrongly?

original: ci zhig ma rtogs shing log par rtogs snyam pa'i dogs pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci zhig ma rtogs shing log par rtogs snyam pa'i dogs pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThe non-existence of the duality and the existence of that non-existence.‚Äù

original: @2b gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: @2b gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the words ‚Äúselflessness of persons and things. ‚Äù

original: 'di ni re zhig bsdus pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig bsdus pa'i don te /
translated: This is the brief meaning.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya'o //
translated: The detailed meaning should be stated.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the words ‚Äúselflessness of persons and things,‚Äù

original: gang zag dang chos rnams ni gang zag dang chos rnams so //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos rnams ni gang zag dang chos rnams so //
translated: persons and things are persons and things.

original: gang zhing zag pas na gang zag ste /
analyzed: gang zhing zag pas na gang zag ste /
translated: A person is so called because he is filled with and defiled by the defilements.

original: de ni sngon med pa'i las bstsags pa'i phyir gang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sngon med pa'i las bstsags pa'i phyir gang ba'o //
translated: He is filled because he accumulates karma that has not existed before.

original: sngon byas pa'i las yongs su spyad pas zad pa'i phyir zag pa'o //
analyzed: sngon byas pa'i las yongs su spyad pas zad pa'i phyir zag pa'o //
translated: He is defiled because he exhausts karma that has been previously accumulated.

original: yang dang yang 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bas na yang gang zag go //
analyzed: yang dang yang 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bas na yang gang zag go //
translated: Again and again he goes to that and that destination, thus he is a person.

original: yang na gang ngam brtas nas 'phen pa dang rdzogs par byed pa'i las rnams kyis 'gro bar 'gro bas na gang zag go //
analyzed: yang na gang ngam brtas nas 'phen pa dang rdzogs par byed pa'i las rnams kyis 'gro bar 'gro bas na gang zag go //
translated: Or, he is a person because he goes to a destination by means of the karma that impels and perfects the growth of the person.

original: rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pas chos rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pas chos rnams so //
translated: Things are so called because they hold their own characteristics.

original: 'di ltar bdag dang bral ba de ni bdag med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag dang bral ba de ni bdag med de /
translated: Thus, that which is devoid of self is selfless.

original: de'i dngos po ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: Its reality is selflessness.

original: bdag med pa dang bdag med pa ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang bdag med pa ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: The selflessness of the self and the selflessness of phenomena are the selflessness of the self and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gang zag dang chos rnams la bdag med pa ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos rnams la bdag med pa ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The selflessness of persons and of phenomena is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa dag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa dag go //
translated: Therefore, these are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa rnams dang / log par rtogs pa rnams zhes tshig sdud pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa rnams dang / log par rtogs pa rnams zhes tshig sdud pa'o //
translated: Those who do not understand and those who misunderstand are those who do not understand and those who misunderstand, a summary of the words.

original: ma rtogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par ma rig pa'o //
translated: Those who do not understand are those who do not know the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: log par rtogs pa dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who misunderstand are of two types.

original: kha cig ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par phyin ci log tu rtogs te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par phyin ci log tu rtogs te /
translated: Some misunderstand the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: gang gis phyin ci log ces bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gang gis phyin ci log ces bya ba dag go //
translated: Those who misunderstand are those who misunderstand.

original: kha cig gis rnam pa gnyis su rtogs te /
analyzed: kha cig gis rnam pa gnyis su rtogs te /
translated: Some misunderstand in two ways.

original: gang gis the tshom za zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gang gis the tshom za zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: Those who doubt are those who doubt.

original: de'i phyir mi shes pa dang phyin ci log dang the tshom gyi blo can rnams la zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi shes pa dang phyin ci log dang the tshom gyi blo can rnams la zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that those who are ignorant, mistaken, and doubtful are the ones who are to be guided.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma log par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de dag phyin ci ma log par zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma log par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de dag phyin ci ma log par zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ba ste /
translated: In order to teach the selflessness of persons and phenomena without error, the phrase ‚Äúin order to teach the selflessness of persons and phenomena without error‚Äù is a grammatical construction.

original: de gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes tshig sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes tshig sdud pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to teach those two‚Äù is a summary statement.

original: kha cig ni gang zag la bdag med pa phyin ci log tu 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni gang zag la bdag med pa phyin ci log tu 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that the selflessness of persons is erroneous.

original: 'di lta ste kun gyis bkur ba rnams te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste kun gyis bkur ba rnams te /
translated: For example, the Sammitiyas.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni bdag med par 'dod kyi gang zag med par ni ma yin no //üîΩkha cig ni chos la bdag @3a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni bdag med par 'dod kyi gang zag med par ni ma yin no // kha cig ni chos la bdag @3a * //
translated: Because they assert that there is no self, but not that there is no person.

original: med pa yang phyin ci log tu 'dod de /
analyzed: med pa yang phyin ci log tu 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that the selflessness of phenomena is erroneous.

original: 'di lta ste dbu ma pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dbu ma pa rnams so //
translated: For example, the Madhyamikas.

original: de dag ni chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du med par ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag ni chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du med par ni mi 'dod de /
translated: They do not assert that phenomena do not exist in any way.

original: brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med par ni mi 'dod do zhes grag go //
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med par ni mi 'dod do zhes grag go //
translated: But it is not maintained that they are nonexistent by way of an imagined nature.

original: de'i phyir de'i gnyen por chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa phyin ci ma log par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i gnyen por chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa phyin ci ma log par bstan par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to remedy that, the non-self of phenomena and the non-self of persons are taught without error.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩrnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams so zhes bya ba ni de sum cu yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ba smos so // rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams so zhes bya ba ni de sum cu yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúwithout error.‚ÄùüîΩThe Thirty Verses on Representation-Only are composed.

original: rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúverses‚Äù is a compound word meaning that it is thirty and it is a composition on representation-only.

original: rab tu byed pa de'i tshig le'ur byas pa sum cu yod pas 'di ni tshig le'ur byas pa sum cu pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa de'i tshig le'ur byas pa sum cu yod pas 'di ni tshig le'ur byas pa sum cu pa'o //
translated: Since there are thirty verses in that composition, this is the Thirty Verses.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du yongs su ston par byed pa'i rab tu byed pa yin pas rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du yongs su ston par byed pa'i rab tu byed pa yin pas rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa'o //
translated: It is a composition on representation-only because it is a composition that teaches that everything is representation-only.

original: de brtsams pa ni rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: de brtsams pa ni rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams pa ste /
translated: The composition of that is the composition of the Thirty Verses on Representation-Only.

original: de ni 'di skad du sems can gang dag gang zag dang chos la bdag med par mi shes pa rnams dang / gang dag dogs pa rnams dang / gang dag phyin ci log tu gyur pa de dag la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma log par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sems can gang dag gang zag dang chos la bdag med par mi shes pa rnams dang / gang dag dogs pa rnams dang / gang dag phyin ci log tu gyur pa de dag la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma log par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being taught: ‚ÄúThe Thirty Verses on Representation were composed in order to teach the selflessness of persons and things to those sentient beings who do not know the selflessness of persons and things, to those who are doubtful, and to those who are mistaken about the selflessness of persons and things.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa bstan pa mdzad snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa bstan pa mdzad snyam pa la /
translated: Why did he teach the selflessness of persons and things?üîΩIn response to this, he says,

original: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bstan pa yang /
analyzed: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bstan pa yang /
translated: ‚ÄúThe teaching of the selflessness of persons and things . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgang yang 'dir gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bstan par byed pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gang yang 'dir gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bstan par byed pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: and so forth.üîΩThe teaching of the selflessness of persons and things is for the sake of eliminating the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the selflessness of persons is for the sake of eliminating the afflictive obstructions.

original: chos la bdag med par bstan pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par bstan pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the selflessness of dharmas is for the sake of eliminating the obscurations to knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag spang zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag spang zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeliminating the obscurations of the afflictions and of the knowable‚Äù should be analyzed as two objects of a single verb.

original: de dag spang ngo zhes bya bar tshig sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de dag spang ngo zhes bya bar tshig sdud pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeliminating those‚Äù is a summary statement.

original: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ji lta bu snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ji lta bu snyam pa la /
translated: How is it that the teaching of the selflessness of persons is for the sake of eliminating the afflictions?

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag tu lta ba las byung ngo zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag tu lta ba las byung ngo zhes smras so //
translated: It is said that the afflictions, such as desire, arise from the view of self.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags @3b la sogs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba las 'byung ngo //üîΩde ltar na nga zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags @3b la sogs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba las 'byung ngo // de ltar na nga zhe'am /
translated: Thus desire and so on arise from the view of the perishable composite.üîΩThus, in relation to what is agreeable and disagreeable, there arises attachment and aversion, etc.,

original: nga'i zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa rnams la rjes su chags pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: nga'i zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa rnams la rjes su chags pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skye'o //
translated: in accord with the view that ‚ÄúI am‚Äù or ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba spangs pa 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba spangs pa 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: One who has abandoned the view of self and what belongs to a self is free from attachment.

original: ste'u dang tsandan du 'dra ba rnams ni gang la yang rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: ste'u dang tsandan du 'dra ba rnams ni gang la yang rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa mi skye'o //
translated: One who is like a stump or like sandalwood does not generate attachment or aversion, etc. toward anything.

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung na de ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung na de ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /
translated: If attachment, etc. arise from what is called ‚Äúself,‚Äù how is that?

original: de'i phyir / gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúOne who has realized the selflessness of the person . . . ‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, attachment, etc. arise from the view of self.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa khong du chud pa ni bdag tu lta ba de'i dngos kyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa khong du chud pa ni bdag tu lta ba de'i dngos kyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: Realizing the selflessness of the person is the direct antidote to that view of self.

original: de'i phyir gang zag la bdag med par mthong na bdag tu lta ba spong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag la bdag med par mthong na bdag tu lta ba spong ngo //
translated: Therefore, if one sees the selflessness of the person, one abandons the view of self.

original: de spangs na de las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spangs na de las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one abandons that, one abandons all attachment, etc. that arise from it.

original: de bas na gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of selflessness with regard to persons is for the sake of abandoning the afflictions.

original: chos la bdag med pa bstan pas ji ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa spang snyam pa la chos la bdag med par shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa bstan pas ji ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa spang snyam pa la chos la bdag med par shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: How is the obscuration of the knowable abandoned by the teaching of selflessness with regard to phenomena?

original: 'di ltar chos la bdag med par shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos la bdag med par shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The knowledge of selflessness with regard to phenomena is the antidote to the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de'i phyir chos la bdag med par shes pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos la bdag med par shes pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by the knowledge of selflessness with regard to phenomena, the obscuration of the knowable is abandoned.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa 'dis ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa 'dis ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: What is the use of abandoning the afflictive and the knowable obscurations?

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The abandonment of the afflictive and the knowable obscurations is for the sake of attaining the two kinds of knowledge.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba ni thar pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba ni thar pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The abandonment of the afflictions such as attachment is for the sake of attaining liberation.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The elimination of the obscurations to knowledge is for the sake of attaining omniscience.üîΩThe elimination of the afflictions is for the sake of attaining liberation.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba ni thar pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de ji lta bu snyam pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba ni thar pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de ji lta bu snyam pa la /
translated: How is that?

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe elimination of the afflictions,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni thar pa thob pa la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni thar pa thob pa la sgrib par byed de /
translated: In this way, the afflictions such as attachment obscure the attainment of liberation.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag spangs na thar pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag spangs na thar pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when those such as attachment are eliminated, one attains liberation.

original: 'o na zhes bya'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig / de spangs pas thams cad mkhyen pa thob @4a * //üîΩpar ni ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig / de spangs pas thams cad mkhyen pa thob @4a * // par ni ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: What is the nature of the obscurations? How is omniscience attained by eliminating them?

original: de'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe obscurations to knowledge,‚Äù and so on.

original: shes bya thams cad la ye shes 'jug pa'i bar du gcod par byed pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir shes bya'i sgrib par 'dod do //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la ye shes 'jug pa'i bar du gcod par byed pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir shes bya'i sgrib par 'dod do //
translated: The obscuration to omniscience is the non-afflicted nescience that obstructs the engagement of wisdom in all objects of knowledge, and it is called the ‚Äúhabit-energy of the adherence to the apprehended and apprehender.‚Äù

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa de lta bu de spangs par gyur na 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad kun la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa de lta bu de spangs par gyur na 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad kun la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug ste /
translated: When that kind of obscuration to omniscience is abandoned, then in this way, wisdom engages all aspects of objects of knowledge, both mundane and supramundane, without attachment and without obstruction.

original: de'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs na thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs na thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the obscuration to omniscience is abandoned, omniscience is attained.

original: shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la rnam pa thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang / bdag med par shes par bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la rnam pa thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang / bdag med par shes par bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll aspects of objects of knowledge‚Äù means that all aspects are to be known as impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless.

original: de ni shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the aspect of all objects of knowledge.

original: chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called the wisdom that is free from attachment and obstruction.

original: gang res 'ga' 'jug la res 'ga' mi 'jug pa de ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang res 'ga' 'jug la res 'ga' mi 'jug pa de ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which sometimes engages and sometimes does not engage is called attachment because it depends on other causes.

original: gang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa med par 'jug pa de ni chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa med par 'jug pa de ni chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which engages without depending on other causes is called free from attachment.

original: gang la lar 'jug la lar mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba de ni thogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la lar 'jug la lar mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba de ni thogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which engages in some places and does not engage in other places is called obstruction.

original: gang thams cad du 'jug pa de ni thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang thams cad du 'jug pa de ni thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which engages everywhere is called unobstructed.

original: de ltar re zhig dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bshad pa rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bshad pa rnam pa gcig go //
translated: Thus, the purpose of the purpose has been explained in one aspect.

original: yang dgos pa'i yang dgos pa gzhan du rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir yang na chos dang gang zag la mngon par zhen pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: yang dgos pa'i yang dgos pa gzhan du rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir yang na chos dang gang zag la mngon par zhen pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In order to teach the other purpose of the purpose in another aspect, it is said: Those who are attached to the Dharma and persons, etc.

original: smra ba kha cig ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa brtags pa'i chos rnams la'ang rdzas su mngon par zhen /
analyzed: smra ba kha cig ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa brtags pa'i chos rnams la'ang rdzas su mngon par zhen /
translated: Some proponents of tenets cling to the substantial reality of phenomena that are imputed, such as the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres.

original: kha cig ni gang zag la'ang mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gang zag la'ang mngon par zhen te /
translated: Some cling to the substantial reality of the person.

original: gang dag de ltar chos dang gang zag la mngon par zhen pa de dag 'di ltar sems tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
analyzed: gang dag de ltar chos dang gang zag la mngon par zhen pa de dag 'di ltar sems tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
translated: Those who cling to the substantial reality of phenomena and the person do not know mind only as it is in reality.

original: de'i phyir de dag la chos dang gang zag la bdag med par ston te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la chos dang gang zag la bdag med par ston te /
translated: Therefore, the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of the person are taught to them.

original: ci nas kyang de dag rnam par rig pa tsam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la mthar gyis 'jug par bya ba de'i don du chos dang gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir rab @4b tu byed pa brtsams so //
analyzed: ci nas kyang de dag rnam par rig pa tsam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la mthar gyis 'jug par bya ba de'i don du chos dang gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir rab @4b tu byed pa brtsams so //
translated: In order to gradually introduce them to mind only and its result, this treatise was composed in order to teach the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of the person.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
translated: The mere representation of consciousness together with its result is the mind and mental factors free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its result is the stage of the Joyful One and so on.

original: mthar gyis 'jug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thog mar gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i thabs su gyur pa rab tu byed pa sum cu pa la sogs pa nyan to //
analyzed: mthar gyis 'jug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thog mar gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i thabs su gyur pa rab tu byed pa sum cu pa la sogs pa nyan to //
translated: In order to enter gradually is to listen to the thirty chapters and so on, which are the means of destroying the apprehended and apprehender.

original: thos nas de'i 'og tu phyin ci ma log par rig pas sems so //üîΩbsams nas de'i 'og tu gzung ba rnam par gzhig pa'i thog mar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: thos nas de'i 'og tu phyin ci ma log par rig pas sems so // bsams nas de'i 'og tu gzung ba rnam par gzhig pa'i thog mar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Having listened, one then reflects with unmistaken knowledge.

original: bzod pa'i bar du goms par byed do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i bar du goms par byed do //
translated: Having reflected, one then cultivates the foundations of mindfulness and so on up to acceptance, which are the beginning of the destruction of the apprehended object.

original: de nas gzung ba rnam par bshig nas gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang med do zhes chos kyi mchog gi dus na 'dzin pa yang rnam par 'jig go //
analyzed: de nas gzung ba rnam par bshig nas gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang med do zhes chos kyi mchog gi dus na 'dzin pa yang rnam par 'jig go //
translated: Then, having destroyed the object, since there is no object, there is no subject. Thus, at the time of the supreme mundane quality, the subject is also destroyed.

original: rnal 'byor pas de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par bshig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par bshig pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the yogi/nƒ´, having destroyed the object and subject,

original: chos kyi dbyings sgrib pa re re bral bas sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa la sbyar te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings sgrib pa re re bral bas sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa la sbyar te /
translated: connects with the grounds of Supreme Joy and so forth, which are free from the obscurations of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de ltar na rnam par rig pa tsam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la mthar gyis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rig pa tsam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la mthar gyis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one enters in stages into mere consciousness and its result.

original: yang dgos pa'i yang dgos pa gzhan du rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dgos pa'i yang dgos pa gzhan du rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the other, the ultimate purpose, in another way,

original: yang na rnam par shes pa bzhin du shes bya yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa bzhin du shes bya yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúOr, like consciousness, the object of consciousness also . . .‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba kha cig ni ji ltar rnam par shes pa rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du shes bya yang rdzas nyid du yod do snyam du sems /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba kha cig ni ji ltar rnam par shes pa rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du shes bya yang rdzas nyid du yod do snyam du sems /
translated: Some proponents of external objects think that just as consciousness exists substantially, so too the object of consciousness exists substantially.

original: dbu ma pa kha cig ni ji ltar shes bya kun rdzob tu yod kyi don dam par med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dbu ma pa kha cig ni ji ltar shes bya kun rdzob tu yod kyi don dam par med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Some Madhyamikas think that just as objects of knowledge exist conventionally but do not exist ultimately,

original: rnam par shes pa yang kun rdzob nyid du yod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang kun rdzob nyid du yod kyi /
translated: so consciousness exists only conventionally,

original: don dam par ni med do snyam du sems zhes grags te /
analyzed: don dam par ni med do snyam du sems zhes grags te /
translated: but not ultimately.

original: de'i phyir mtha' gcig tu smra ba 'di rnam pa gnyis dgag par gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa brtsams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtha' gcig tu smra ba 'di rnam pa gnyis dgag par gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa brtsams so //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute these two kinds of extreme assertions, the treatise was composed in order to demonstrate the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.

original: mtha' gcig tu smra ba 'di rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad yod par smra ba dang / thams cad med par smra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu smra ba 'di rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad yod par smra ba dang / thams cad med par smra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The two kinds of extreme assertions are synonymous with the assertions that everything exists and the assertions that everything is nonexistent.

original: de ltar rab tu byed pa brtsams pa'i dgos pa brjod do /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byed pa brtsams pa'i dgos pa brjod do /
translated: Thus, the purpose of composing the treatise has been stated.

original: // /'o na ji ltar chos dang gang zag la bdag med par shes par bya snyam pa la /üîΩbdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa //
analyzed: // /'o na ji ltar chos dang gang zag la bdag med par shes par bya snyam pa la / bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa //
translated: Now, how should one understand the selflessness of persons and of phenomena?

original: zhes bya ba la @5a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la @5a * //
translated: The text states:üîΩThe self and phenomena are imputed in dependence upon the aggregates,

original: sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sogs pa smras te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di ltar bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa rnam pa du ma gang 'byung ba zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa rnam pa du ma gang 'byung ba zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the summary is: ‚ÄúThe many designations of self and the many designations of phenomena that occur.‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: dogs pa dang bcas pa yin pas tshig khong nas dbyung ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dogs pa dang bcas pa yin pas tshig khong nas dbyung ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Since this is doubtful, in order to teach the inner meaning of the words,

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúin the world and in the treatises,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa rnam pa du ma gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa rnam pa du ma gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the summary is: ‚ÄúThe many designations of self and the many designations of phenomena that occur in the world and in the treatises.‚Äù

original: gang la blta bar bya snyam pa la /üîΩde ni rnam par shes pa gyur /
analyzed: gang la blta bar bya snyam pa la / de ni rnam par shes pa gyur /
translated: If one wonders what is to be seen,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat is the transformation of consciousness.‚Äù

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha la 'byung ngo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha la 'byung ngo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the summary is: ‚ÄúThat occurs in the apprehended aspect of consciousness.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra gang dang sbyar snyam pa la /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra gang dang sbyar snyam pa la /
translated: If one wonders to what the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúThe many designations of self and the many designations of phenomena.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúone should connect this with the designation of self and phenomena.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa la bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa la bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the designation of self and phenomena.

original: de las ni tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las ni tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows:

original: bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las rnam pa du ma gang 'byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha nyid la 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las rnam pa du ma gang 'byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha nyid la 'byung ste /
translated: The designation of self and phenomena, which occurs in many ways in the world and in treatises, occurs in the aspect of the object of consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi bdag gam chos rnams la nye bar 'dogs pa 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bdag gam chos rnams la nye bar 'dogs pa 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur in the designation of external selves or phenomena.

original: de bas na gang zag dang chos rnams la bdag med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang zag dang chos rnams la bdag med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: 'grel pa byed pas yan lag gi don dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas yan lag gi don dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the branches, the commentator says:

original: bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe designation of self and phenomena,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gis bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa de ni bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa de ni bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
translated: That by which one is designated as a self is the designation of a self.

original: de bzhin du gang gis chos su nye bar 'dogs pa ni chos su nye bar 'dogs pa ni chos su nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gis chos su nye bar 'dogs pa ni chos su nye bar 'dogs pa ni chos su nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, that by which one is designated as a dharma is the designation of a dharma.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the term designation,

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat also is a designation,‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'i sgra ni bdag tu btags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'i sgra ni bdag tu btags par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term designation of a self should be understood as the designation of a self.

original: chos su nye bar 'dogs pa'i sgra yang chos su btags pa'o //
analyzed: chos su nye bar 'dogs pa'i sgra yang chos su btags pa'o //
translated: The term designation of a dharma is also the designation of a dharma.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa dang btags pa dang tha snyad ces bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa dang btags pa dang tha snyad ces bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: Designation, designation, and convention are synonyms.

original: shes pa dang brjod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are synonymous with cognition and expression.

original: sna tshogs kyi sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
