translated: Since objects of knowledge are the nature of consciousness itself,

original: phyi rol na bdag dang chos kyi dngos po med la rten med par ni kun rdzob tu yang mi rung bas de bas na shes bya thams cad kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol na bdag dang chos kyi dngos po med la rten med par ni kun rdzob tu yang mi rung bas de bas na shes bya thams cad kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there are no real entities of selves and phenomena external to consciousness. And since it is not tenable that there is a concealer without a basis, therefore all objects of knowledge are not substantially real because they are the imagined nature.

original: 'di ltar rten med par kun rdzob med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten med par kun rdzob med de /
translated: Since there is no concealer without a basis,

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas rdzas su yod ces bya ba de khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas rdzas su yod ces bya ba de khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: therefore consciousness is substantially real because it is dependently arisen.

original: rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that consciousness is dependently arisen?

original: rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.üîΩConsciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gyur pa'i sgra nyid kyis bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gyur pa'i sgra nyid kyis bstan te /
translated: The word ‚Äúarises‚Äù indicates that the effect is not the same as its cause.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang mi 'dra ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid thob par ni gyur ba'o //üîΩzhes bstan pa'o //üîΩde ltar dngos su bdag dang chos rnams bkag pa dang / phyi rol gyi don du smra bas phyir brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang mi 'dra ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid thob par ni gyur ba'o // zhes bstan pa'o // de ltar dngos su bdag dang chos rnams bkag pa dang / phyi rol gyi don du smra bas phyir brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: The effect is the attainment of a state that is different from its cause.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par shes pa nyid don gyi rnam par 'byung ba 'di ji ltar shes par rung zhe na /üîΩzhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par shes pa nyid don gyi rnam par 'byung ba 'di ji ltar shes par rung zhe na / zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Thus, the existence of a self and of phenomena is directly refuted, and the opponent objects that if external objects do not exist, how can consciousness itself arise in the aspect of an object?üîΩThe opponent asks, ‚ÄúIf external objects do not exist, how can consciousness itself arise in the aspect of an object?‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi don gzugs la sogs pa med par rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ba de ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gzugs la sogs pa med par rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ba de ji ltar shes she na /
translated: The Proponents of Consciousness ask, ‚ÄúIf external objects such as forms do not exist, how can consciousness itself arise in the aspect of an object such as a form?‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The Proponents of Mind Only respond:

original: phyi rol gyi don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúExternal objects are . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don gang gi tshe bdag gi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don gang gi tshe bdag gi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'dod kyi /
translated: Thus, when external objects generate consciousness that has their aspect, they are asserted to be the objective conditions of consciousness.

original: byed rgyu tsam 'ba' zhig tu 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu tsam 'ba' zhig tu 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not asserted to be mere active causes.

original: gal te byed rgyu tsam gyis dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te byed rgyu tsam gyis dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur na ni /
translated: If they were objects merely by being active causes,

original: de'i tshe rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang / @7b bdag po'i rkyen dang / bye brag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang / @7b bdag po'i rkyen dang / bye brag med par 'gyur te /
translated: then the causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, and the dominant condition would be no different.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni byed rgyu tsam du rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni byed rgyu tsam du rnam par 'jog go //
translated: This is because they are posited as mere active causes.

original: gal te 'di yang byed rgyu tsam du rnam par gzhag na ni de'i tshe de dag dang bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di yang byed rgyu tsam du rnam par gzhag na ni de'i tshe de dag dang bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are posited as mere active causes, then they would be no different from those.

original: de ni 'di skad du gang la byed rgyu kho na dang rang gi rnam pa bskyed pa kho na yod pa de ni chos nyid gnyes dang ldan pa yul du 'dod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang la byed rgyu kho na dang rang gi rnam pa bskyed pa kho na yod pa de ni chos nyid gnyes dang ldan pa yul du 'dod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being taught: ‚ÄúThat which has only the activity of the causal condition and only the generation of its own effect is accepted as the object that possesses the two natures.‚Äù

original: byed rgyu tsam gyi phyir yul nyid du 'dod na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa rkyen rnams kyang dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu tsam gyi phyir yul nyid du 'dod na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa rkyen rnams kyang dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object is accepted as the object of consciousness because it is the mere activity of the causal condition, then the immediately preceding condition and so on would also be the object of consciousness.

original: chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa'i yul du gyur du zin kyang 'dis cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa'i yul du gyur du zin kyang 'dis cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if it is the object that possesses the two natures, what is the consequence of that?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni bsags pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni bsags pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The five collections of consciousness have an aggregate as their object.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni bsags pa la dmigs par gzhan 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni bsags pa la dmigs par gzhan 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that the five collections of consciousness have an aggregate as their object.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni bsags pa'i rnam pa dag rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni bsags pa'i rnam pa dag rig par bya'o //
translated: In this way, they should be known as having the aspect of an aggregate.

original: bsags pa'i sgra ni 'dus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bsags pa'i sgra ni 'dus pa la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù refers to a collection.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni rigs pa'i rnam par snang bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni rigs pa'i rnam par snang bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the five collections of consciousness are explained to appear as the aspect of reasoning.

original: bsags pa'i rnam par gyur na ci nyes zhe na /
analyzed: bsags pa'i rnam par gyur na ci nyes zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with the collection being a transformation?

original: de'i phyir bsags pa ni cha shas 'dus pa tsam las gud na med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsags pa ni cha shas 'dus pa tsam las gud na med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúthe collection does not exist apart from the mere aggregation of parts.‚Äù

original: cha shas bsags pa rnams 'dus pa tsam las bsags pa gud na med do //
analyzed: cha shas bsags pa rnams 'dus pa tsam las bsags pa gud na med do //
translated: The collection does not exist apart from the mere aggregation of the parts.

original: ji ltar med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar med ce na /
translated: How does it not exist?

original: cha shas de dag bsal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: cha shas de dag bsal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúif the parts are removed, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar cha shas re re nas bsal na bsags pa'i rnam pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar cha shas re re nas bsal na bsags pa'i rnam pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, if the parts are removed one by one, the consciousness that has the aspect of the collection does not occur.

original: gal te de na 'dus pa zhes bya ba rdzas ci yang rung ba zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te de na 'dus pa zhes bya ba rdzas ci yang rung ba zhig yod na ni /
translated: If the so-called collection is some kind of substance,

original: de'i tshe cha shas re re nas bsal na yang 'dus pa'i rnam pa'i blo skye ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe cha shas re re nas bsal na yang 'dus pa'i rnam pa'i blo skye ba zhig na /
translated: then even if the parts are removed one by one, the cognition of the collection would still occur.

original: cha shas can gyi rdzas yod pa ni slob dpon rnams kyis dgag pa mang du brjod do //
analyzed: cha shas can gyi rdzas yod pa ni slob dpon rnams kyis dgag pa mang du brjod do //
translated: The existence of a substantial whole is refuted by the masters in many ways.

original: de ltar 'dus pa'i rdzas yod pa bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'dus pa'i rdzas yod pa bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted the existence of a substantial whole, he concludes:

original: de bas na phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par shes pa bsags pa'i rnam pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par shes pa bsags pa'i rnam pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, consciousness arises in the aspect of an accumulation without external objects.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bsags pa ni cha shas 'dus pa tsam las gud na yod pa ma yin par yang bsags pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di myong ste /üîΩde bas na phyi rol gyi bsags pa'i don med par spros pa'i bag chags @8a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bsags pa ni cha shas 'dus pa tsam las gud na yod pa ma yin par yang bsags pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di myong ste / de bas na phyi rol gyi bsags pa'i don med par spros pa'i bag chags @8a * //
translated: Because that accumulation does not exist apart from the mere collection of parts, this consciousness in the aspect of an accumulation is experienced.

original: yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa bsags pa'i rnam par 'byung bar grub bo //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa bsags pa'i rnam par 'byung bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that consciousness arises in the aspect of an accumulation without external objects that are accumulations, due to the ripening of the latent potentials of conceptualization.

original: 'dus pa'i rdzas med pa dmigs par mi rung du zin yang rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na yang de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rdzas med pa dmigs par mi rung du zin yang rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na yang de'i phyir /
translated: Even though it is not suitable for a nonexistent substantial whole to be an object of perception, the consciousness of the collection of subtle atoms is its object.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa dag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa dag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe mere collection of subtle particles, etc.‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab 'dus pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa de'i dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab 'dus pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa de'i dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere collection of subtle particles is not the object of that consciousness.

original: bsags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Mere collection‚Äù means ‚Äúmere aggregation.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir dmigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dmigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the object?

original: rdul phra rab dag ni de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag ni de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause the subtle particles do not have the aspect of that.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gang 'di shes pa la rags pa'i rnam par snang ba rnam pa de dag rdul phra rab so so la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang 'di shes pa la rags pa'i rnam par snang ba rnam pa de dag rdul phra rab so so la ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the aspect of that which appears as gross to consciousness does not exist for each subtle particle.

original: so so de'i rnam pa ma yin yang 'dus pa ni de'i rnam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: so so de'i rnam pa ma yin yang 'dus pa ni de'i rnam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that although each subtle particle does not have that aspect, the collection does have that aspect,

original: de'i phyir / rdul phra rab rnams ma bsags pa'i dus las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rdul phra rab rnams ma bsags pa'i dus las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúThe subtle particles do not have the aspect of that at the time they are not collected, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ma bsags pa'i dus na rags pa'i rnam pa med pa de ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar ma bsags pa'i dus na rags pa'i rnam pa med pa de ltar /
translated: Just as the aspect of grossness does not exist at the time they are not collected,

original: rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa'i dus na yang rags pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa'i dus na yang rags pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa ci yang med do //
translated: And when the subtle particles are aggregated, there is no change in their nature whatsoever, so that they would have the character of the gross.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa dag dmigs par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du bsags pa rnams kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa dag dmigs par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du bsags pa rnams kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, just as the non-aggregated subtle particles are not apprehended, so the aggregated ones are not apprehended either.

original: de ma 'dus pa bzhin du 'dus pa yang dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ma 'dus pa bzhin du 'dus pa yang dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that, just as the non-aggregated are not apprehended, so the aggregated are not apprehended either.

original: de ni 'di skad du /üîΩji ltar de dag ma 'dus na rags pa med de /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du / ji ltar de dag ma 'dus na rags pa med de /
translated: This is what is being said:üîΩSince the gross does not exist when they are not aggregated, it is not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir dmigs par ma gyur pa de bzhin du 'dus su zin kyang rags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs par ma gyur pa de bzhin du 'dus su zin kyang rags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, even when they are aggregated, the gross does not exist.

original: de bas na dmigs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na dmigs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: So how could it be apprehended?

original: 'di ltar de dag tha dad dam 'dus kyang rung zlum ril mi 'dor ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag tha dad dam 'dus kyang rung zlum ril mi 'dor ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, whether they are distinct or aggregated, the gross is not relinquished.

original: yang la la rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa yin par rnam pa gzhan du 'dod de /
analyzed: yang la la rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa yin par rnam pa gzhan du 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, some assert a different mode of apprehension of the subtle particles.

original: de'i phyir de'i lugs bstan par gzhan dag rdul phra rab re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i lugs bstan par gzhan dag rdul phra rab re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that system, others say, ‚ÄúEach atom,‚Äù and so on.

original: rdul phra rab re re rdul phra rab gzhan la mi ltos pa ni dbang po'i yul du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rdul phra rab re re rdul phra rab gzhan la mi ltos pa ni dbang po'i yul du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Each atom, not depending on other atoms, would not be an object of the sense faculties.

original: gang gi tshe phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa de dbang po'i yul du 'gyur bar sems zhes grag ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa de dbang po'i yul du 'gyur bar sems zhes grag ste /
translated: When they mutually depend, they become objects of the sense faculties.

original: phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: phyogs 'di yang rigs pa bzod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs 'di yang rigs pa bzod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this position is not tenable,

original: de dag gi yang @8b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de dag gi yang @8b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: they say, ‚ÄúEven in their system,‚Äù and so on.

original: de skad smra ba de dag gi gzhung ltar na yang rdul phra rab nyams su 'ong zhes rdul phra rab rnams ltos pa dang bcas pa dang mi ltos pa'i dus na yang rags pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa med do //
analyzed: de skad smra ba de dag gi gzhung ltar na yang rdul phra rab nyams su 'ong zhes rdul phra rab rnams ltos pa dang bcas pa dang mi ltos pa'i dus na yang rags pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa med do //
translated: Even according to the scriptures of those who say this, atoms are not objects of the sense faculties. Whether atoms mutually depend or not, they do not have a different nature that is the character of the coarse.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa med pas yang na ni dus thams cad du dbang pos bzung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa med pas yang na ni dus thams cad du dbang pos bzung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference in their nature, either the sense faculty would always apprehend them,

original: yang na ni nams kyang dbang pos mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni nams kyang dbang pos mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would never apprehend them.

original: yang de nyid la nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de nyid la nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate another fault in that ,

original: gal te phan tshun ltos pa'i rdul phra rab nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gal te phan tshun ltos pa'i rdul phra rab nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf the subtle particles are mutually dependent, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te phan tshun ltos pa'i rdul phra rab dag nyid rnam par shes pa'i yul du 'gyur du zin na ni /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun ltos pa'i rdul phra rab dag nyid rnam par shes pa'i yul du 'gyur du zin na ni /
translated: If the subtle particles that are mutually dependent were to become the object of consciousness,

original: de ltar na bum pa dang zangs bum dang rdza ma dang kham phor la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa la snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na bum pa dang zangs bum dang rdza ma dang kham phor la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa la snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the differences in the form of a pot, a copper pot, a clay pot, a bowl, and so on would not appear to consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab dag bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab dag bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the subtle particles are not the form of a pot, etc.

original: 'di la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, this is the argument:

original: rdul phra rab rnams nyid bum pa la sogs pa shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams nyid bum pa la sogs pa shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: The atoms themselves are the objects of the cognition of the pot, etc.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa la snang ba yang gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa la snang ba yang gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe appearance in consciousness is also different,‚Äù etc.

original: bum pa dang rdza ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin pas /
analyzed: bum pa dang rdza ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin pas /
translated: The form of the pot, the form of the clay, etc.

original: phra mo'i rnam pa ni rags pa'i rnam pa shes pa'i yul du mi rung ste ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnam pa ni rags pa'i rnam pa shes pa'i yul du mi rung ste ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The subtle form is not suitable as the object of the cognition of the gross form, because it would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: de lta na ni sbrang bu yang glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam pa shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sbrang bu yang glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam pa shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, even a mosquito would be the object of the cognition of the form of an elephant, etc.

original: de lta re zhig rdul phra rab dag yod pas khas blangs te /
analyzed: de lta re zhig rdul phra rab dag yod pas khas blangs te /
translated: Thus, for the time being, atoms are accepted as existing,

original: dmigs par bkag go //
analyzed: dmigs par bkag go //
translated: but their being the object is refuted.

original: de ni de dag kyang yod par mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni de dag kyang yod par mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show that it is not tenable that they exist,

original: phra rab dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: phra rab dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe atoms also,‚Äù etc.

original: rdul phra rab kyang tshu rol dang pha rol dang dpung gi cha yod pas ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyang tshu rol dang pha rol dang dpung gi cha yod pas ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the subtle particle has a part that is this side, that side, and the middle, like a pillar, etc., it does not exist ultimately.

original: ka ba la sogs pa ni brtags par yod pa'o //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa ni brtags par yod pa'o //
translated: Pillar, etc., are imputedly existent.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni mi 'dra ba'i chos so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni mi 'dra ba'i chos so //
translated: Feeling, etc., are different dharmas.

original: brgya la gzhan gtan tshigs ma grub ces zer du dogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brgya la gzhan gtan tshigs ma grub ces zer du dogs pa'i phyir //
translated: In case one should say that the reason is not established,

original: de khas mi len na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de khas mi len na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: in order to anticipate that, he says, ‚ÄúIf one does not accept, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams kyi tshu rol dang pha rol dang dpung gi cha khas mi len na ni /üîΩde'i tshe rdul phra rab las ltos nas 'di ni @9a * //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams kyi tshu rol dang pha rol dang dpung gi cha khas mi len na ni / de'i tshe rdul phra rab las ltos nas 'di ni @9a * //
translated: If one does not accept that the subtle particles have a part that is this side, that side, and the middle,

original: shar phyogs // 'di ni byang phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs tha dad pa dag rdul phra rab rnams kyi yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shar phyogs // 'di ni byang phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs tha dad pa dag rdul phra rab rnams kyi yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, in that case, in dependence on the subtle particles, this is the east, this is the north, etc., the different directions would not be the subtle particles.

original: de med par gyur na shar dang byang la sogs pa yang rdul phra rab kyi char mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par gyur na shar dang byang la sogs pa yang rdul phra rab kyi char mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is not so, the east, north, etc., would not be a part of the subtle particle.

original: de ltar gyur na ci nyes she na //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ci nyes she na //
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúlike consciousness. . . .‚Äù

original: gal te rdul phra rab kyi phyogs cha tha dad pa khas mi len na de'i tshe ji ltar rnam par shes pa lus med pa dang / yul na mi gnas pa bzhin du rdul phra rab dag kyang de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab kyi phyogs cha tha dad pa khas mi len na de'i tshe ji ltar rnam par shes pa lus med pa dang / yul na mi gnas pa bzhin du rdul phra rab dag kyang de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not accept the different parts of the atom, then just as consciousness is without body and without location, so too must the atoms be.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi don bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar na phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi don bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar na phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Having thus refuted external objects, in order to summarize, it is said, ‚ÄúThus, because external objects do not exist. . . .‚Äù

original: gang de skad bstan pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don mi 'thad de //
analyzed: gang de skad bstan pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don mi 'thad de //
translated: In this way, external objects are not tenable according to the teaching.

original: de bas na spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bas na spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, one should accept that consciousness itself arises in the aspect of such objects as form due to the ripening of the latent propensities of conceptualization,

original: dper na rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: just like the consciousness in a dream.

original: de ltar na re zhig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams kyi yul bkag go //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams kyi yul bkag go //
translated: Thus, the objects of the five collections of consciousness have been refuted.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the object of mental consciousness, he says:

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúFeeling, etc., are also like that.‚Äù

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag ni dus gsum du gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag ni dus gsum du gtogs pa ste /
translated: Feeling, etc., are included in the three times.

original: de la re zhig gang dag 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dag ni rang gi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dag ni rang gi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Among them, those that are past and future do not generate consciousness having their own aspect,

original: 'das pa rnams ni 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa rnams ni 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past have ceased and

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the future have not yet arisen.

original: 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If that which has ceased and that which has not yet arisen do not substantially exist,

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur //
translated: how can they generate consciousness?

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the following is the case:

original: da ltar gyi dag skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dag skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe present ones generate it.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir da ltar gyi dag kyang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smras so / da ltar gyi tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang rang gi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skyed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar gyi dag kyang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smras so / da ltar gyi tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang rang gi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skyed do //
translated: The present feelings, etc. do not produce the consciousness of their own aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye ba'i tshe na ni med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩde la skye ba'i tshe na skyed par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe na ni med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so // de la skye ba'i tshe na skyed par 'gyur ram /
translated: Because they do not exist at the time of arising.üîΩIn this regard, does the producer produce at the time of arising?

original: skyes pa'i tshe skyed par 'gyur zhes gnyis su brtag grang na /
analyzed: skyes pa'i tshe skyed par 'gyur zhes gnyis su brtag grang na /
translated: Or does it produce at the time of having arisen?

original: skye ba'i tshe na ni tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ma @9b yin no /
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe na ni tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ma @9b yin no /
translated: At the time of arising, feeling, etc. do not exist.

original: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pas skyed par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pas skyed par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, since they do not exist, how can they be producers?

original: gang gi tshor ba la sogs skyes pa'i tshe na ni rnam par shes pa yang de'i rnam par skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshor ba la sogs skyes pa'i tshe na ni rnam par shes pa yang de'i rnam par skyes pa nyid do //
translated: When feeling, etc. have arisen, consciousness has already arisen in their aspects.

original: de'i phyir de la bya ba cung zad kyang med pas de dag ni de'i skyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la bya ba cung zad kyang med pas de dag ni de'i skyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since they have no function at all, they are not producers of that.

original: de bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yang ci yang med par grub bo //
analyzed: de bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yang ci yang med par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the object of the mental consciousness is also established as being nothing at all.

original: de ltar na gzung ba med pas rnam par shes pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba med pas rnam par shes pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since there is no object, consciousness does not exist as a subject.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i mtshan nyid chos la bdag med par grub bo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i mtshan nyid chos la bdag med par grub bo //
translated: The nonexistence of the object and subject is the establishment of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa ni rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du bstan pas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa ni rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du bstan pas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The selflessness of persons is taught by demonstrating that consciousness arises in dependence on conditions.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel ba 'byung ba'i phyir yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel ba 'byung ba'i phyir yod do //
translated: Thus, consciousness exists because it arises in dependence on conditions.

original: gal te gang zag dag kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gang zag dag kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that persons arise in dependence on conditions, then they are impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa la bdag tu rtog pa ni don med de lus dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la bdag tu rtog pa ni don med de lus dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pointless to imagine that an impermanent person is a self, because that person is similar to a body.

original: ji ste rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar mi 'dod na ni de lta na rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar mi 'dod na ni de lta na rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not assert that persons arise in dependence on conditions, then they are permanent.

original: rtag pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa dang de'i 'bras bu la spyod pa mi nus te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa dang de'i 'bras bu la spyod pa mi nus te /
translated: The self is not permanent, because it cannot perform virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and experience their results,

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is immutable.

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos zhes byar ni bye brag tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir mi 'dod do //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos zhes byar ni bye brag tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir mi 'dod do //
translated: Nor is it tenable to say that it depends on the cooperating conditions, because it is not differentiated.

original: de'i phyir cung zad kyang byed pa med pa yongs su brtags pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir cung zad kyang byed pa med pa yongs su brtags pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of this imputation of something that does not perform any function whatsoever?

original: gang zag la bdag med par yang grub po //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par yang grub po //
translated: Thus, the selflessness of persons is established.

original: de ni slob dpon snga ma dag gis kyang mang du bstan zin te /
analyzed: de ni slob dpon snga ma dag gis kyang mang du bstan zin te /
translated: This has been extensively taught by the past masters.

original: de bas na 'dir mngon du ma bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir mngon du ma bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not explained here.

original: 'dir brda sprod pa pa la sogs pas phyir rgol ba ston te /üîΩgzhan dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir brda sprod pa pa la sogs pas phyir rgol ba ston te / gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the grammarians and so on are shown to be opponents.

original: gal te bdag dang chos dngos su med na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha la de nye bar 'dogs par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag dang chos dngos su med na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha la de nye bar 'dogs par mi rung ste /
translated: Others say that if the self and phenomena do not exist as real entities, then it is not tenable to impute them to the apprehended aspect of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar nye bar 'dogs pa ni gsum yod na 'gyur gyi gsum po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar 'dogs pa ni gsum yod na 'gyur gyi gsum po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the designation is made when three conditions are present; it is not made when any one of the three is absent.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: don gyi dngos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: don gyi dngos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe real thing, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te don gyi dngos yod pa dang / gal te dngos dang 'dra ba gzhan 'ga' zhig yod pa dang / dngos dang de dang 'dra ba gnyi ga dang 'dra ba yang yod de //üîΩgal te 'dra ba ci yang rung ba @10a * //
analyzed: gal te don gyi dngos yod pa dang / gal te dngos dang 'dra ba gzhan 'ga' zhig yod pa dang / dngos dang de dang 'dra ba gnyi ga dang 'dra ba yang yod de // gal te 'dra ba ci yang rung ba @10a * //
translated: If the real thing exists, if something else similar to the real thing exists, and if both the real thing and that which is similar to it exist,

original: zhig yod na ni de'i tshe nye bar 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: zhig yod na ni de'i tshe nye bar 'dogs par byed do //
translated: if something similar to something exists, then the designation is made.

original: 'dir dper smos pa dper na dngos med dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dper smos pa dper na dngos med dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here he gives an example: ‚ÄúFor example, the non-existent, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos med yod la me dang 'dra ba bram ze'i khye'u dang me dang bram ze'i khye'u gnyi ga'i thun mong gi chos yang na ser ba nyid dam /
analyzed: dngos med yod la me dang 'dra ba bram ze'i khye'u dang me dang bram ze'i khye'u gnyi ga'i thun mong gi chos yang na ser ba nyid dam /
translated: The non-existent is the boy, the existent is the fire, and the common property of both the boy and the fire is either the state of being smoky or the state of being similar to fire.

original: yang na rno ba nyid yod na 'jig rten na bram ze'i khye'u la mer nye bar 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: yang na rno ba nyid yod na 'jig rten na bram ze'i khye'u la mer nye bar 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Or, if sharpness exists, then in the world, it is applied to the Brahmin boy.

original: gal te de ltar rnam par shes par gyur ba la bdag dang chos nye bar 'dogs par byed na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rnam par shes par gyur ba la bdag dang chos nye bar 'dogs par byed na /
translated: If consciousness is applied to the self and dharmas,

original: yang de'i tshe bdag dang chos rnams dngos su yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe bdag dang chos rnams dngos su yod par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time the self and dharmas would actually exist.

original: gzhan du na ni nye bar 'dogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni nye bar 'dogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be applied. This is the opponent's position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas thog ma nyid du dpe sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas thog ma nyid du dpe sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion, in order to refute the example at the outset,

original: 'di ltar bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar 'dogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //üîΩgang 'di bram ze'i khye'u la me zhes dper gzhag pa 'di la rigs me nyid ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar 'dogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // gang 'di bram ze'i khye'u la me zhes dper gzhag pa 'di la rigs me nyid ces bya ba'am /
translated: says, Thus, the application of fire to the Brahmin boy... and so on.üîΩIn this example of fire applied to the Brahmin boy, is it the nature of fire,

original: 'on te me'i rdzas bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar 'dogs //
analyzed: 'on te me'i rdzas bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar 'dogs //
translated: or is the substance of fire applied to the Brahmin boy?

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: ci 'di la me'i spyi'am 'on te me'i rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar 'dogs zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci 'di la me'i spyi'am 'on te me'i rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar 'dogs zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that this is either the universal of fire or the intrinsic identity of fire that is metaphorically designated.

original: de lta na de la nyes pa ci yod ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na de la nyes pa ci yod ce na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the fault in that?

original: nye bar 'dogs pa gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said that neither metaphorically designated is possible.

original: phyogs gnyi ga yang nye bar 'dogs par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga yang nye bar 'dogs par mi rung ngo //
translated: Neither of the two positions is suitable for metaphorical designation.

original: rigs kyi phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the class,

original: de la re zhig thun mong ser ba nyid dam /
analyzed: de la re zhig thun mong ser ba nyid dam /
translated: it is said that the commonality of being yellow or sharp

original: rno ba nyid ni rigs kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rno ba nyid ni rigs kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: is not the class.

original: bram ze'i khye'u dang thun mong ba ser ba nyid dam rno ba nyid ni rigs me nyid la med de /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u dang thun mong ba ser ba nyid dam rno ba nyid ni rigs me nyid la med de /
translated: The commonality of being yellow or sharp with a Brahmin boy does not exist in the class of fire,

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag rigs ni ser ba'am rno bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag rigs ni ser ba'am rno bar mi 'dod do //
translated: because others do not assert that the class is yellow or sharp.

original: 'di ltar yon tan 'di dag ni rdzas kyi yin gyi rigs kyi ni ma yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yon tan 'di dag ni rdzas kyi yin gyi rigs kyi ni ma yin par 'dod do //
translated: In this way, these qualities are asserted to be of the substance, not of the class.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: In this regard, it would be like this.

original: thun mong gi chos med kyang rigs nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong gi chos med kyang rigs nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even without a common property, a class can be imputed.

original: zhen / de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhen / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: thun mong gi chos med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: thun mong gi chos med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWithout a common property, etc.‚Äù

original: thun mong gi chos med pa ni bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar 'dogs par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: thun mong gi chos med pa ni bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar 'dogs par mi rung ngo //
translated: Without a common property, it is not suitable to impute a class to a Brahmin boy.

original: ci'i phyir mi rung snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rung snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it not suitable?

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt would follow, absurdly, that . . .‚Äù

original: gal te thun mong gi chos med par yang nye bar 'dogs par byed na ni de'i tshe thams @10b cad la thams cad nye bar 'dogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te thun mong gi chos med par yang nye bar 'dogs par byed na ni de'i tshe thams @10b cad la thams cad nye bar 'dogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to impute without a common property, then it would follow, absurdly, that everything could be imputed to be anything.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what he is saying.

original: 'dra ba ni nye bar 'dogs pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni nye bar 'dogs pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: Similarity is the basis for imputation.

original: gal te 'dra ba med par yang nye 'dogs par byed na ni de'i tshe nges par byed pa med pas thams cad la thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba med par yang nye 'dogs par byed na ni de'i tshe nges par byed pa med pas thams cad la thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to impute without similarity, then, since there would be no basis for certainty, it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be imputed to be anything.

original: brgya la gzhan nye bar 'dogs pa'i gzhi gzhan smra ba dogs nas /
analyzed: brgya la gzhan nye bar 'dogs pa'i gzhi gzhan smra ba dogs nas /
translated: But if the basis of the designation of the other is suspected of being spoken of as another,

original: rigs chos nyid de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //üîΩrigs ni rno ba la sogs pa chos can ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rigs chos nyid de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // rigs ni rno ba la sogs pa chos can ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven though the caste is not endowed with those two natures,‚Äù and so on.üîΩEven though the caste is not the substratum of the natures of sharpness and yellowness,

original: rno ba nyid du ser ba nyid ni rigs me nyid med na med de /
analyzed: rno ba nyid du ser ba nyid ni rigs me nyid med na med de /
translated: yellowness is not without the nature of sharpness.

original: de'i phyir rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid rigs med na med pas bram ze'i khye'u la rigs me nyid nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid rigs med na med pas bram ze'i khye'u la rigs me nyid nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since yellowness and sharpness are not without the caste, the caste is designated in the young brahmin.

original: de ni 'di skad du thun mong gi chos med du zin kyang med na me mi 'byung ba ni 'dir nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du thun mong gi chos med du zin kyang med na me mi 'byung ba ni 'dir nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: This is what he is saying: Even though there is no common property, the non-existence of which fire would not occur is the cause of the designation here.

original: de'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the absurd consequence does not follow.

original: chos nyid de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos nyid de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the caste is not endowed with those two natures,‚Äù

original: rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid de gnyis ni chos so //
analyzed: rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid de gnyis ni chos so //
translated: those two, sharpness and yellowness, are properties.

original: rigs gang yin pa de ni chos de gnyis dan ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs gang yin pa de ni chos de gnyis dan ldan pa'o //
translated: That which is a type is endowed with those two properties.

original: de'i dngos po ni de'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de'i chos nyid do //
translated: Its entity is its intrinsic nature.

original: chos nyid de gnyis dang mi ldan pa ni chos nyid de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid de gnyis dang mi ldan pa ni chos nyid de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not endowed with those two intrinsic natures is not endowed with those two intrinsic natures.

original: de'i phyir chos nyid de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ni rigs la rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid kyi chos med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos nyid de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ni rigs la rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid kyi chos med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, that which is not endowed with those two intrinsic natures does not have the properties of sharpness and whiteness in the type. This is the meaning.

original: med par mi 'byung ba yang 'dir med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med par mi 'byung ba yang 'dir med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the absence of the two properties is also not established,

original: rigs med pa yang rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid bram ze'i khye'u la mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rigs med pa yang rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid bram ze'i khye'u la mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, the absence of the type is seen in the youth of the Brahmin, in sharpness and whiteness.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid ni rigs me nyid med par yang bram ze'i khye'u la snang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid ni rigs me nyid med par yang bram ze'i khye'u la snang ste /
translated: Thus, sharpness and whiteness appear in the youth of the Brahmin even in the absence of the type of fire.

original: de bas na med par mi 'byung ba de gnyis kyang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na med par mi 'byung ba de gnyis kyang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, the absence of the two properties is also not established.

original: 'di ltar rigs me nyid ni bram ze'i khye'u la med la rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid ni de la yod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs me nyid ni bram ze'i khye'u la med la rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid ni de la yod na /
translated: Thus, the Brahmin boy does not have the fire-nature, but he does have sharpness and yellowness.

original: de gnyis rigs me nyid med par mi 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de gnyis rigs me nyid med par mi 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can those two not occur without the fire-nature?

original: brgya la nyes pa de nyid kyis 'jigs nas gzhan bram ze'i khye'u la yang rigs med par mi 'byung ba de gnyis yod par 'dod na de'i phyir //
analyzed: brgya la nyes pa de nyid kyis 'jigs nas gzhan bram ze'i khye'u la yang rigs med par mi 'byung ba de gnyis yod par 'dod na de'i phyir //
translated: If you accept that those two exist in the Brahmin boy without the fire-nature, out of fear of that very fault,

original: med par me 'byung ba ni nye bar 'dogs pa med de zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩgal te bram ze'i khye'i la yang rno ba nyid dang ser ba @11a * //
analyzed: med par me 'byung ba ni nye bar 'dogs pa med de zhes bya ba smras so // gal te bram ze'i khye'i la yang rno ba nyid dang ser ba @11a * //
translated: then it is said that the occurrence of fire without the fire-nature is not a metaphor.

analyzed: nyid rigs med par mi 'byung ba yang yod par 'dod na ni de'i tshe bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar gdags par mi bya'o //
translated: If you accept that sharpness and yellowness exist in the Brahmin boy without the fire-nature, then at that time the fire-nature should not be metaphorically imputed to the Brahmin boy.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: me bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: me bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of being like fire, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar ji ltar me la rigs me nyid dngos su yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar me la rigs me nyid dngos su yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Thus, just as the fire-nature actually exists in fire,

analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u la yang yod na ni de'i phyir nye bar gdags ci dgos /
translated: If a Brahmin boy also has it, then what is the point of designating it as a Brahmin?

analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gal te bram ze'i khye'u la yang rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid rigs med par mi 'byung ba yang yod par 'dod na ni /
translated: This is what it says: If you assert that sharpness and paleness exist in a Brahmin boy, but do not occur in the absence of a caste,

analyzed: de'i tshe de la de yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: then at that time you accept that it exists in him.

original: de'i phyir yod pas nye bar gdags ci dgos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pas nye bar gdags ci dgos te /

original: gang la gang med pa de la de nye bar 'dogs pa ni mi rigs so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la gang med pa de la de nye bar 'dogs pa ni mi rigs so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is untenable to designate something as existent in that which does not exist.

original: de ltar nye bar 'dogs pa'i gzhi bsal nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /üîΩde bas na bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar gdags su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar 'dogs pa'i gzhi bsal nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir / de bas na bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar gdags su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Having thus refuted the basis of designation, to conclude he says,üîΩTherefore it is untenable to designate a Brahmin boy as a Brahmin.

original: 'di ltar nye bar gdags pa'i gzhi de lta bu rnam pa gnyis ka yang rigs la mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar 'dogs pa mi srid par gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar gdags pa'i gzhi de lta bu rnam pa gnyis ka yang rigs la mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar 'dogs pa mi srid par gnas so //
translated: Thus since both of these modes of the basis of designation are untenable in a caste, therefore it is impossible to designate a Brahmin boy as a Brahmin.

original: rigs nye bar 'dogs par mi 'gyur du zin kyang rdzas nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / rdzas kyang nye bar gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: rigs nye bar 'dogs par mi 'gyur du zin kyang rdzas nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe na / de'i phyir / rdzas kyang nye bar gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: Even if the class is not designated, the substance is designated.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúSubstance also is not suitable to be designated.‚Äù

original: me'i rdzas kyang bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar 'dogs mi srid do //
analyzed: me'i rdzas kyang bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar 'dogs mi srid do //
translated: The substance of fire is not suitable to be designated in the young brahmin.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no common property.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

analyzed: 'di ltar me dang bram ze'i khye'u'i thun mong gi chos ni gang yang med do //
translated: In this way, there is no common property at all of fire and the young brahmin.

original: yon tan rno ba dang ser ba thun mong pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan rno ba dang ser ba thun mong pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt sharpness and yellowness common?

original: thun mong gi chos med ces smra zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong gi chos med ces smra zhe na /
translated: If you say there is no common property,

original: de'i phyir me'i yon tan rno ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir me'i yon tan rno ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: then it is said: ‚ÄúThe sharpness of the quality of fire,‚Äù and so on.

original: yon tan rno ba dang ser ba ni de gnyis kyi thun mong ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan rno ba dang ser ba ni de gnyis kyi thun mong ma yin te /
translated: Sharpness and yellowness are not common to both.

analyzed: 'di ltar me'i yon tan rno ba'am ser ba gang yin pa de nyid ni bram ze'i khye'u'i yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the quality of sharpness or whiteness that belongs to fire is not accepted as belonging to the brahman youth.

analyzed: de'i phyir bram ze'i khye'u'i yon tan rno ba'am ser ba ni me'i yon tan rno ba dang ser ba las gzhan no //
translated: Therefore, the quality of sharpness or whiteness that belongs to the brahman youth is different from the quality of sharpness or whiteness that belongs to fire.

analyzed: 'di ltar bye brag gang yin pa de dag ni /

analyzed: rang rang gi gnas dang 'brel ba yin gyi /

original: gnas gzhan du 'gro bar @11b mi nus te /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du 'gro bar @11b mi nus te /
translated: They are not able to go to another basis.

original: 'di ltar me ni shing bsregs par nus pas rno ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar me ni shing bsregs par nus pas rno ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: Thus, fire is called sharp because it is able to burn wood.

analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u ni byed pa rnams la g-yer bas rno ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The brahman youth is called sharp because he is skilled in his actions.

original: de bzhin du yon tan ser ba yang tha dad du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan ser ba yang tha dad du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the quality of whiteness should be stated as different.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, this is the argument:

original: bram ze'i khye'u'i yon tan rno ba'am ser ba gang yin pa de nyid la brten te /üîΩbram ze'i khye'u la mer nye bar 'dogs so zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / me'i yon tan med par bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar gdags pa ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable to designate the boy as fire without the quality of fire.‚Äù

original: bram ze'i khye'u'i yon tan rno ba'am ser ba gang yin pa de ni me'i yon tan ma yin te /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u'i yon tan rno ba'am ser ba gang yin pa de ni me'i yon tan ma yin te /
translated: The sharpness or heat which is the quality of the boy is not the quality of fire.

analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar gzhan gyi yon tan gyis bram ze'i khye'u la mer nye bar gdags par rung /
translated: Therefore, how could it be reasonable to designate the boy as fire on the basis of the quality of another?

original: de ltar gyur na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be designated as anything.

original: brgya la gzhan gyis de gnyis kyi 'dra ba gzhan du brjod du dogs pas /
analyzed: brgya la gzhan gyis de gnyis kyi 'dra ba gzhan du brjod du dogs pas /

analyzed: gal te me'i yon tan dang 'dra bas rigs so zhe na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: then it would be reasonable if the similarity were with the quality of fire.

translated: Thus, since the sharpness or whiteness that is a quality of fire and the sharpness or whiteness that is a quality of the young brahmin are similar, therefore, based on that similarity, the young brahmin is designated as fire. There is no contradiction.

analyzed: me'i yon tan dang 'dra bas rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la yon tan dang 'dra ba zhes pa'i sgra ni yon tan gyi rigs su 'dod do //
translated: In this case, the term ‚Äúsimilar to the qualities of fire‚Äù is asserted to be a type of quality.

analyzed: 'dra ba rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di ni skabs kyi skyabs su cung zad kyang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this kind of similarity does not at all become the basis in this context,

analyzed: de lta na yang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he said ‚ÄúNevertheless, because of similarity‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: gal te yon tan 'dra ba de yod du zin kyang de dag yon tan 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: Even if the similarity of qualities did exist,

analyzed: 'di ltar me ni yon tan gyi rigs dang 'brel pa nyid med do //
translated: Because fire is not related to the class of qualities.

original: 'di ltar yon tan gyi rigs ni yon tan rnams dang ldan gyi /

analyzed: de ltar rdzas nye bar gdags pa bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted the imputation of substance, in order to conclude,

original: gang gi phyir 'di rdzas la @12a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di rdzas la @12a * //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist in substance,

original: yang thun mong gi chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: yang thun mong gi chos gang yang med de /
translated: there is no common quality at all.

original: de bas na bram ze'i khye'u la me'i rdzas nye bar gdags su yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de bas na bram ze'i khye'u la me'i rdzas nye bar gdags su yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is not appropriate to impute the substance of fire to the Brahmin boy.‚Äù

original: de ltar dpe la nye bar 'dogs pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar dpe la nye bar 'dogs pa bkag nas /

analyzed: dngos yod na nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /

analyzed: ci'i phyir 'das zhe na de'i phyir gtso bo la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

analyzed: 'di ltar gtso bo la shes pa dang brjod pa yon tan can gyi tshul gyis rtag tu 'jug par zad de /
translated: Because the pradhƒÅna is always engaged in the manner of possessing the qualities of cognition and expression.
