analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni mi rtogs so zhes 'di ni pha rol gyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The essence of the self is not known. This is the opponent‚Äôs philosophical position.

original: gtso bo'i sgra ni 'dir bye brag gi gzhir brjod pa yin ta rdzas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo'i sgra ni 'dir bye brag gi gzhir brjod pa yin ta rdzas la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúprimary‚Äù is stated here as the basis of the distinction, namely, substance and so on.

original: yon tan gyi sgra ni 'dir bye brag tu brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan gyi sgra ni 'dir bye brag tu brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúquality‚Äù is stated here as the distinction,

original: dkar po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'o //
translated: namely, white and so on.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the following is the case:

original: gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo la yang shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis kyis reg go snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo la yang shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis kyis reg go snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: If the essence of the primary is touched by both cognition and expression, then for that reason

original: gzhan du na yon tan don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gzhan du na yon tan don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: it would be pointless to posit qualities.

original: gal te gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo la yang shes pa dang / brjod pa gnyis kyis reg par nus na /
analyzed: gal te gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo la yang shes pa dang / brjod pa gnyis kyis reg par nus na /
translated: If the essence of the primary could be touched by both cognition and expression,

original: de'i tshe ci'i phyir yon tan rnams yongs su brtag / gal te gtso bo la shes pa dang / brjod pa gnyis dngos su 'jug pa med na ni de'i tshe gtso bo ni yon tan gyi ngo bor gyur pa shes te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci'i phyir yon tan rnams yongs su brtag / gal te gtso bo la shes pa dang / brjod pa gnyis dngos su 'jug pa med na ni de'i tshe gtso bo ni yon tan gyi ngo bor gyur pa shes te /
translated: then why imagine qualities? If cognition and expression do not directly engage the primary, then at that time the primary would be known as the essence of the qualities.

original: yon tan yongs su brtags par rigs so //
analyzed: yon tan yongs su brtags par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to examine the qualities.

original: gang gi tshe gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis kyis mngon sum du shes na ni de'i tshe yon tan rnams ci dgos //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis kyis mngon sum du shes na ni de'i tshe yon tan rnams ci dgos //
translated: When the nature of the principal is known by both knowledge and expression, then what need is there for the qualities?

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, this is the argument:

original: shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo la mngon sum du 'jug pa ni med mod kyi /
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo la mngon sum du 'jug pa ni med mod kyi /
translated: Indeed, knowledge and expression do not directly engage the nature of the principal.

original: 'on te cis kyang thabs gzhan 'ga' zhig gi gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo shes par byed do snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te cis kyang thabs gzhan 'ga' zhig gi gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo shes par byed do snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: But if one thinks that the nature of the principal is known by some other means, then in response to that, it is said:

original: shes pa dang brjod pa ma @12b gtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa ma @12b gtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Apart from knowledge and expression, there is no other means of knowing the nature of the principal.

original: blo dang sgra ma gtogs par gang gi gtso bo de shes pa'i gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i thabs gzhan med do //
analyzed: blo dang sgra ma gtogs par gang gi gtso bo de shes pa'i gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i thabs gzhan med do //
translated: Apart from cognition and sound, there is no other means of knowing the nature of the principal, which is the object of knowledge.

original: de ltar gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i thabs med par bstan nas mjug bsdu pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i thabs med par bstan nas mjug bsdu pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus shown that there is no means of knowing the nature of the principal, in conclusion, it is said:

original: de'i phyir gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the object is the essence of the primal substance itself.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar gtso bo de'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i thabs gzhan ni gang yang med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar gtso bo de'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i thabs gzhan ni gang yang med la /
translated: Since there is no other means of ascertaining the essence of the primal substance,

original: shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis ni de la mi 'jug pa de'i phyir don gyi dngos me la sogs pa gang yang med par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis ni de la mi 'jug pa de'i phyir don gyi dngos me la sogs pa gang yang med par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: and since cognition and expression do not engage it, one should understand that there is no object, such as fire, that is a real entity.

original: me'i rdzas la blo dang sgra mngon sum du 'jug pa med pas /
analyzed: me'i rdzas la blo dang sgra mngon sum du 'jug pa med pas /
translated: Since cognition and expression do not directly engage the substance of fire,

original: de dngos nyid ma yin du zin kyang me nyid kyi rigs la blo dang sgra mngon sum du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de dngos nyid ma yin du zin kyang me nyid kyi rigs la blo dang sgra mngon sum du 'jug ste /
translated: even though it is not the nature of fire, cognition and expression directly engage the class of fire.

original: de'i phyir de nyid dngos su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid dngos su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it becomes the nature of fire.

original: kye de yang rdzas nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: kye de yang rdzas nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: O, that is also not suitable as a substance.

original: 'di ltar de yang sgra'i rang gi ngo bos bsgyur nas shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis kyis shes kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de yang sgra'i rang gi ngo bos bsgyur nas shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis kyis shes kyi /
translated: Because that is known by both cognition and expression through transforming the nature of sound,

original: rang gi ngo bo ni mi shes na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni mi shes na /
translated: but its nature is not known.

original: de ji ltar dngos nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar dngos nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How could that be the intrinsic reality?

original: sgra la blo dang sgra gnyis mngon sum du 'jug ste /üîΩde'i phyir sgra de nyid dngos su 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: sgra la blo dang sgra gnyis mngon sum du 'jug ste / de'i phyir sgra de nyid dngos su 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: The cognition and the sound are directly engaged with respect to the sound.üîΩTherefore, the sound itself is directly engaged.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du sgra'i bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so//
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du sgra'i bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so//
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúIn the same way, the sound is not directly engaged with respect to the sound,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar rdzas dang rigs la shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis mngon sum du 'jug pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rdzas dang rigs la shes pa dang brjod pa gnyis mngon sum du 'jug pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the cognition and the expression are directly engaged with respect to the substance and the type,

original: sgra la yang de gnyis mngon sum du 'jug pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgra la yang de gnyis mngon sum du 'jug pa med pa nyid de /
translated: in the same way, those two are not directly engaged with respect to the sound.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i rang gi ngo bo dang brjod pa ni 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i rang gi ngo bo dang brjod pa ni 'brel pa med de /
translated: In this way, the intrinsic reality of the sound and the expression are not related.

original: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo dang brjod pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo dang brjod pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the intrinsic reality of the sound and the expression are not different.

original: tha dad pa ni 'brel pa'i gnas yin na ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni 'brel pa'i gnas yin na ni /
translated: If difference is the basis of the relation,

original: tha dad pa med pas de ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pas de ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: how could that be tenable when there is no difference?

original: gzhan dag ni 'brel pa med par gang du yang brjod pa mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'brel pa med par gang du yang brjod pa mi 'jug ste /
translated: Other things are not expressed anywhere without a relation.

original: gang du brjod pa 'jug pa med pa der shes pas yang mi 'jug par 'dod do //
analyzed: gang du brjod pa 'jug pa med pa der shes pas yang mi 'jug par 'dod do //
translated: Where there is no engagement of expression, there is no engagement of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag ni shes pa thams cad rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag ni shes pa thams cad rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod pas /
translated: Thus, others assert that all consciousnesses are conceptual,

original: de ji ltar mngon par brjod pa la mi ltos par 'jug / rigs dang yon tan dang / byed pa yang sgra'i rang gi ngo bo la mi ltos par shes pas mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ji ltar mngon par brjod pa la mi ltos par 'jug / rigs dang yon tan dang / byed pa yang sgra'i rang gi ngo bo la mi ltos par shes pas mi 'dzin to //
translated: so how could it engage without depending on expression? Also, a consciousness that does not rely on the nature of a term does not apprehend a type, quality, or action.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa de dag kyang gzhan la mi srid do //üîΩde ltar shes pa dang brjod pa @13a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa de dag kyang gzhan la mi srid do // de ltar shes pa dang brjod pa @13a * //
translated: Therefore those conceptions are also impossible for others.

original: med par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: med par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the nonexistence of consciousness and expression,

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: in order to summarize that, he says, ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar shes pa dang / brjod pa gang du yang mngon sum du mi 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar shes pa dang / brjod pa gang du yang mngon sum du mi 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since consciousness and expression do not engage in any way,

original: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba med pas don gyi dngos po med par grub bo //
analyzed: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba med pas don gyi dngos po med par grub bo //
translated: because of the nonexistence of expression and the expressed, the nonexistence of the entity of the object is established.

original: de ltar dngos nyid bkag nas btags pa mngon sum du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dngos nyid bkag nas btags pa mngon sum du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, having refuted reality, in order to demonstrate the reality of the designation,

original: yang 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: yang 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAll of these are just designations,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyed kyi gzhung ltar na dngos po gang ji snyed pa thams cad ni btags pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: khyed kyi gzhung ltar na dngos po gang ji snyed pa thams cad ni btags pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: According to your scriptures, all things whatsoever are just designations.

original: dngos ni med de 'di ltar gang na gang med pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa de ni btags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos ni med de 'di ltar gang na gang med pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa de ni btags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There is no reality, because that which engages in the manner of ‚Äúwherever something does not exist‚Äù is called a ‚Äúdesignation.‚Äù

original: sgra thams cad 'jug pa ni gtso bo med par btags pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa'i ngo bo des de la 'jug go //
analyzed: sgra thams cad 'jug pa ni gtso bo med par btags pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa'i ngo bo des de la 'jug go //
translated: All words engage in the nature of that which is designated without a principal.

original: de ni 'di skad du gtso bo ni btags pa'i ngo bor gyur nas sgras shes par byed kyi rang gi ngo bo shes par byed pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gtso bo ni btags pa'i ngo bor gyur nas sgras shes par byed kyi rang gi ngo bo shes par byed pa ni ma yin no /
translated: This is what is being said: the principal becomes the nature of a designation and is known by words, but it is not known by its own nature.

original: de dngos su ji ltar 'gyur zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dngos su ji ltar 'gyur zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: How could it be real?

original: dang po nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang po nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize from the beginning to the end,üîΩhe says,

original: de la bdag dang chos dngos su med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de la bdag dang chos dngos su med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In response to that, it was said, ‚ÄúIf the self and phenomena do not exist in reality‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de ltar khyed kyi gzhung ltar na dngos po gang yang med de /
analyzed: de ltar khyed kyi gzhung ltar na dngos po gang yang med de /
translated: Thus, according to your scriptures, no thing exists at all.

original: de bas na bdag dang chos dngos su med na nye bar 'dogs pa mi rigs so zhes gang smras pa de mi rigs so /üîΩ// / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang chos dngos su med na nye bar 'dogs pa mi rigs so zhes gang smras pa de mi rigs so / // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say, ‚ÄúIf the self and phenomena do not exist in reality, it is illogical to impute them.‚Äù

original: de ltar skabs su bshad pa rdzogs par byas te dkyus ma brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar skabs su bshad pa rdzogs par byas te dkyus ma brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Having completed the explanation of this section, in order to explain the main point,

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: it was said, ‚ÄúThe transformation of consciousness‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gong du bstan pa gang yin pa de'i dbye ba mi shes pas de'i phyir de ston to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gong du bstan pa gang yin pa de'i dbye ba mi shes pas de'i phyir de ston to //
translated: Since the transformation of consciousness taught above is not understood, therefore it is taught.

original: tshig gang gis bstan zhes dris pa dang de'i phyir gyur pa de yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: tshig gang gis bstan zhes dris pa dang de'i phyir gyur pa de yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúBy what words is it taught?‚Äù in response it was said, ‚ÄúThat transformation is also threefold.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gang la bdag nye bar 'dogs pa dang chos nye bar 'dogs par byed pa de rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gang la bdag nye bar 'dogs pa dang chos nye bar 'dogs par byed pa de rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The transformation of consciousness in which the self and phenomena are imputed should be understood as threefold.

original: rnam pa gsum po'i rab tu dbye ba yang bstan pa'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos tha dad do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po'i rab tu dbye ba yang bstan pa'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos tha dad do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the differentiation of the three types, he says, ‚ÄúThey are differentiated by the nature of cause and effect.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa rnam pa gsum po de ni rgyu kho na dang 'bras bu kho nas tha dad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa rnam pa gsum po de ni rgyu kho na dang 'bras bu kho nas tha dad de /
translated: That threefold transformation of consciousness is differentiated only as cause and effect.

original: rgyur gyur pa dang 'bras bur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa dang 'bras bur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is only as cause and only as effect.

original: @13b dang po pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @13b dang po pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the first, he says,

original: de la rgyur gyur pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de la rgyur gyur pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúAmong them, that which is the cause . . .‚Äù

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags rgyas pa gang yin pa de rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags rgyas pa gang yin pa de rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The increase of the impregnations of the karmic result and the impregnations of the cause in the store consciousness is called ‚Äúthe cause.‚Äù

original: bag chags yongs su brtas pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bag chags yongs su brtas pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The consciousness of the store-consciousness which is the development of the latent impressions is called the cause.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi lo rgyus rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi lo rgyus rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅras have three opinions about this.

original: kha cig ni sngon med pa nyid kyi bag chags skyed do zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig ni sngon med pa nyid kyi bag chags skyed do zhes zer /
translated: Some say that the latent impressions are produced anew.

original: gzhan dag na re bag chags ni dus thams cad na yod pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyis yongs su brtas par byed par zad de yongs su brtas nas de'i 'bras bu mngon par bsgrub nus so zhes zer /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bag chags ni dus thams cad na yod pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyis yongs su brtas par byed par zad de yongs su brtas nas de'i 'bras bu mngon par bsgrub nus so zhes zer /
translated: Others say that the latent impressions exist at all times and are merely developed by the dharmas of defilement. When they are developed, they are able to produce their effects.

original: gzhan dag ni snga ma nas yod pa'i bag chags kyang yongs su brtas par byed la sngon med pa dang kyang skyed do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni snga ma nas yod pa'i bag chags kyang yongs su brtas par byed la sngon med pa dang kyang skyed do snyam du sems so //
translated: Others think that the latent impressions that existed previously are developed and that new ones are produced.

original: 'di ni 'grel pa byed pas phyogs par ma gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'grel pa byed pas phyogs par ma gzhag go //
translated: The author of the commentary does not take a position on this.

original: gyur pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu gyur pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gyur pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu gyur pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: To explain the second transformation, he says, ‚ÄúThe transformation of the effect‚Äù and so on.

original: sngon gyi las kyi ris mthun pa gang du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'phangs par gyur pa de yongs su rdzogs la /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi ris mthun pa gang du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'phangs par gyur pa de yongs su rdzogs la /
translated: The maturation of the store consciousness in the realm of form is the result of the store consciousness that was projected in a realm of similar type by previous karma.

original: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'byung ba rnyed nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'byung ba rnyed nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu gyur pa'o //
translated: The actualization of the store consciousness in other realms of similar type after the occurrence of the maturation of the propensities is the transformation of the result.

original: de bzhin du rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags 'byung ba rnyed nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags 'byung ba rnyed nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu gyur pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the actualization of the active forms of consciousness and the afflicted mind from the store consciousness after the occurrence of the propensities of natural outcome is the transformation of the result.

original: 'byung ba rnyed ces bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag tu 'bras bu skyed nus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnyed ces bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag tu 'bras bu skyed nus pa la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúoccurrence‚Äù should be understood as the immediate ability to generate a result.

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gsum po de dag gi nang nas gang zhig gis bag chags gang skyed ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gsum po de dag gi nang nas gang zhig gis bag chags gang skyed ce na /
translated: From among these three transformations of consciousness, which one generates the propensities?

original: de'i phyir / de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúThe virtuous and nonvirtuous active consciousnesses . . .‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags skyed do //üîΩde las gzhan pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam @14a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags skyed do // de las gzhan pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam @14a * //
translated: The virtuous and nonvirtuous active consciousnesses generate the karmic maturation latent afflictions in the store consciousness in order to establish the result of karmic maturation.

original: par shes pa bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags skyed de /
analyzed: par shes pa bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags skyed de /
translated: The other active consciousnesses, which are neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous, generate the homogeneous latent afflictions in order to establish the active consciousnesses that are virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: de'i stobs kyis tshe 'di nyid dang gzhan na de'i rigs kyi sems 'byung ngo //üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de gnyis ni rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis tshe 'di nyid dang gzhan na de'i rigs kyi sems 'byung ngo // 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de gnyis ni rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: By their power, the mind of that type arises in this life and in other lives.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags nyid skyed do //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags nyid skyed do //
translated: The two, the active consciousnesses that are neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous and the afflicted mind, generate only the homogeneous latent afflictions in order to establish their own corresponding results.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i gzhi gding pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i gzhi gding pa'i phyir /

original: gyur pa rnam gsum bshad pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //üîΩgrangs tsam bstan pas bye brag mi shes te //üîΩde bas na bye brag bstan pa'i don du rang gi ming gis gyur pa gsum po bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: rnam par smin dang ngar sems dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: The specific characteristics are not known by merely teaching the number, therefore, in order to teach the specific characteristics, the three transformations are taught by their own names, saying: The transformation of consciousness as retribution, the transformation of consciousness that thinks 'I,' and the transformation of consciousness that is the grasper and the grasped.

original: de dgrol pa'i phyir gyur pa'i rnam pa gsum po de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de dgrol pa'i phyir gyur pa'i rnam pa gsum po de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to explain that, it is said: Those three kinds of transformations.

original: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Since that is easy to understand, it is not explained.

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gsum po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo mdor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gsum po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo mdor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to briefly teach the intrinsic nature of the three transformations of consciousness,

original: de la las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de la las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa rnams kyis 'bras bu mngon par bsgrubs pa gang yin pa de rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gang yin pa de ni dus thams cad du ngar sems pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ngar sems pa zhes bya'o //

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul ltar so sor snang bas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po gang yin pa de ni yul la rnam par rig ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul ltar so sor snang bas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po gang yin pa de ni yul la rnam par rig ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses of the eye, etc., are called ‚Äúthe awareness of objects‚Äù because they appear individually, like objects such as form.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul ltar so sor snang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul ltar so sor snang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i gzhi gding ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i gzhi gding ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the basis of the verse,

analyzed: de bas na gang gi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir / de la kun gzhi'i rnam shes ni //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach their own natures,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa gang yin pa de rnam par smin @14b par gyur pa'o zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //

analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /

original: de la zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba smras te /

original: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //

original: 'di ci'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya snyam pa la /

original: kun gzhi zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: kun gzhi zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la kun gzhi zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa ste /

analyzed: de bas na kun gzhi zhes bya'o // 'di ltar kun gzhi dang gnas zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni /

original: rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi'o //

translated: ‚ÄúEnters‚Äù means ‚Äúis related to‚Äù up to ‚Äúis mixed with.‚Äù

analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa de nyid chos thams cad la rgyu nyid du 'jug ste /
translated: Or, that consciousness itself enters into the cause of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gzhi'o //

original: 'jug pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: ci'i phyir 'di rnam par shes pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di rnam par shes pa zhes bya snyam pa la /

analyzed: rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: 'di ltar yul la rnam par shes par byed pa de bas na rnam par shes pa'o //

original: 'o na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes bya snyam pa la /

original: khams dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang / rigs thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: khams dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang / rigs thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: 'di ltar khams gsum dang / 'gro ba lnga dang / skye gnas pa zhi dang / bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa thams cad du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum dang / 'gro ba lnga dang / skye gnas pa zhi dang / bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa thams cad du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in all the three realms, the five destinies, the four modes of birth, and the four castes such as the brahmin caste, the consciousness that is the basis of all phenomena ripens as virtue and nonvirtue from the consciousness that is the basis of all phenomena.

original: de bas na rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //

original: ci'i phyir 'di sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya snyam pa la /

original: chos thams cad kyi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //üîΩ'di @15a * //üîΩltar 'di ni chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // 'di @15a * // ltar 'di ni chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin te /

original: de bas na sa bon thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sa bon thams cad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the consciousness that is the seed of all things.

original: 'dir mdo sde pas phyir brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde pas phyir brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, the SautrƒÅntika raises an objection:

analyzed: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las gung na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par rnam par shes pa gzhan ni mi rig go //
translated: Apart from the active forms of consciousness, there is no other consciousness that can be known.

original: gal te de dag ma gtogs par kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhan zhig 'dod na /üîΩde'i tshe de'i dmigs pa yang brjod dgos /
analyzed: gal te de dag ma gtogs par kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhan zhig 'dod na / de'i tshe de'i dmigs pa yang brjod dgos /
translated: If you assert a foundation consciousness that is different from those,

original: rnam pa yang brjod dgos te /
analyzed: rnam pa yang brjod dgos te /

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: You cannot have a consciousness that lacks an object and an aspect.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: de dmigs pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de dmigs pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not that it lacks an object.‚Äù

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam pa med par ni kho bo yang mi 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam pa med par ni kho bo yang mi 'dod mod kyi /
translated: We also do not assert that the foundation consciousness lacks an object and an aspect.

original: 'on kyang de ni dmigs pa yongs su mi gsal ba dang / rnam pa yongs su mi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni dmigs pa yongs su mi gsal ba dang / rnam pa yongs su mi gsal ba ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir de 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan yod par mi rigs so //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad par mi srid pas /

original: ci'i phyir zhes dris pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes dris pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /

original: 'di ltar ; kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar ; kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúThe foundation consciousness . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: and so on.

original: de ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni nang gi nye bar len par snang ba dang / phyi rol gyi rnam pa yang yongs su mi gsal ba snod du snang ba dang rnam pa gnyis su 'byung ngo //

translated: Thus the foundation consciousness arises in two aspects: the inner aspect that appears as the appropriated aggregates and the outer aspect that appears as the indistinct form of the world.

original: rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang rnam pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang rnam pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness‚Äù is the inner aspect, and ‚Äúappearance‚Äù is the outer aspect.

original: nang gi nye bar len pa de ji lta bu snyam pa la /
analyzed: nang gi nye bar len pa de ji lta bu snyam pa la /

translated: The internal appropriating is that which is called the internal sense bases, etc. The internal appropriating is the latent impressions of the attachment to the imagined reality, the form of the sense faculties together with their abodes, and the name.

analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa des bag chags gang bskyed pa de nyid brjod do //

original: gnas dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la gnas ni lus la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la gnas ni lus la bya'o //

original: ming zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung @15b po bzhi po rnams so //üîΩdmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad nas mi gsal ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung @15b po bzhi po rnams so // dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad nas mi gsal ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The name is the four aggregates of feeling, etc.üîΩHaving explained the nature of the object, in order to demonstrate the reason for its obscurity, he says,

analyzed: de'i dmigs pa shin tu phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because its object is extremely subtle.

original: de'i dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis gang bshad pa de shin tu phra bas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de ni len pa mi rigs pa dang / gnas su rnam par rig pa mi rigs par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis gang bshad pa de shin tu phra bas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de ni len pa mi rigs pa dang / gnas su rnam par rig pa mi rigs par 'dod do //
translated: The two aspects of its object are explained to be extremely subtle, and thus it is maintained that the appropriating consciousness and the consciousness that is the basis are untenable.

original: 'grel pa'i tshig rnams ni tshig sdud pa sngon du btang nas don khong du chud par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'grel pa'i tshig rnams ni tshig sdud pa sngon du btang nas don khong du chud par 'gyur bas /

original: tshig sdud par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: tshig sdud par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gang la nye bar len pa'i rnam par rig pa mi rigs pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rig pa mi rigs pa yod pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de len pa dang gnas kyi rnam par rig pa mi rigs par 'dod do //
translated: The appropriating consciousness and the consciousness that is the basis are untenable in the foundation consciousness.

original: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa ni gnas kyi rnam pa dang / gnas su snang ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa ni gnas kyi rnam pa dang / gnas su snang ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The consciousness that is the basis is the aspect of the basis up to the appearance as the basis.

original: len pa zhes bya ba 'di gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: len pa zhes bya ba 'di gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is this called ‚Äúappropriation‚Äù?

original: len pa de ni len par byed pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: len pa de ni len par byed pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de yang bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so ;
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de yang bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so ;
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúIt is the latent impressions of the conception of self, etc.‚Äù

original: ; bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog par rnams kyis bag chags bskyed pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams su rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis bag chags bskyed pa gang yin pa de 'dir len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ; bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog par rnams kyis bag chags bskyed pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams su rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis bag chags bskyed pa gang yin pa de 'dir len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The latent impressions generated by the conception of self, etc., and the latent impressions generated by the conception of form, etc., are called appropriation.

original: ci'i phyir bag chags de len pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bag chags de len pa zhes bya zhe na /

original: de'i phyir de yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúBecause of the existence of that, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bag chags rnam pa 'di lta bu yod pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas bdag la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos su rnam par rtog pa 'bras bu len pas de'i phyir bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bag chags rnam pa 'di lta bu yod pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas bdag la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos su rnam par rtog pa 'bras bu len pas de'i phyir bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: Because such latent impressions exist, the consciousness of the ground of all takes on the concept of a self and so on, and the concept of form and so on as phenomena.

original: gzugs la sogs pa chos su rnam par rtog pa de dag gi bag chags de ni len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa chos su rnam par rtog pa de dag gi bag chags de ni len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore the latent impressions of the concepts of a self and so on, and of form and so on as phenomena, are called ‚Äúappropriation.‚Äù

original: de las tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of the term is as follows.

original: de yod na ji skad brjod pa'i 'bras bu len par byed de /
analyzed: de yod na ji skad brjod pa'i 'bras bu len par byed de /
translated: If it exists, it appropriates the results as described.

original: de bas na bag chags la len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bag chags la len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore latent impressions are called ‚Äúappropriation.‚Äù

original: len pa bshad nas @16a * //
analyzed: len pa bshad nas @16a * //
translated: Having explained appropriation,

original: ji ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa len pa mi rigs pa zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir de ni 'di la 'di'o zhes tshor ba'i rnam par mi rigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa len pa mi rigs pa zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir de ni 'di la 'di'o zhes tshor ba'i rnam par mi rigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: in order to demonstrate how it is illogical for the consciousness of the ground of all to be appropriation, the text says, ‚ÄúIt is illogical for it to be the feeling of ‚Äòthis is mine.‚Äô‚Äù

original: len pa zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas 'di la 'di'o zhes so sor rang gis rig pa'i rnam par mi rigs te /
analyzed: len pa zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas 'di la 'di'o zhes so sor rang gis rig pa'i rnam par mi rigs te /
translated: That which is taught as appropriation is not reasonable as the individual self-awareness of the store consciousness thinking ‚Äúthis is that.‚Äù

original: de bas na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de len pa mi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de len pa mi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the store consciousness is not reasonable as appropriation.

original: len pa gnyis pa'i don len pa la sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: len pa gnyis pa'i don len pa la sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to apply the meaning of the second appropriation,

original: yang na gnas nye bar len pas len pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: yang na gnas nye bar len pas len pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúOr, it is appropriation because it appropriates a basis.‚Äù

original: gnas zhes bya ba yang nye bar len pas len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba yang nye bar len pas len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The so-called basis is also called appropriation.

original: gnas zhes bya ba de gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba de gang yin snyam pa la /

original: gnas ni lus so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gnas ni lus so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúThe basis is the body.‚Äù

original: lus nyid gnas su bstan to //
analyzed: lus nyid gnas su bstan to //

original: gnas de yang gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i gzugs dang ming du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de yang gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i gzugs dang ming du rig par bya'o //
translated: And that basis should be understood as the form of the sense faculties together with their basis, and as name.

original: de'i phyir phung po lnga pa dag ni gnas zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lnga pa dag ni gnas zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the five aggregates are taught as the basis.

original: ji ltar na gnas len pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas len pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
translated: How is the basis called appropriation?

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa gang yin pa ni nye bar 'gro ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa gang yin pa ni nye bar 'gro ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThat which appropriates is that which goes to, etc.‚Äù

original: gnas de'i len pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gnas de'i len pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: That which appropriates the basis is that which goes to,

original: de grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas len pa'o //
analyzed: de grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas len pa'o //

original: len pa ni nye bar 'gro ba'i sgrar bstan te /
analyzed: len pa ni nye bar 'gro ba'i sgrar bstan te /
translated: Appropriation is indicated by the term ‚Äúthat which goes to.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar nye bar len pa dang / nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'byung ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar len pa dang / nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'byung ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, appropriation, going to, and arising are synonyms.

original: de las tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of the terms is as follows:

original: phung po lnga po dag grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas len te nye bar 'gro ba dang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas len te nye bar 'gro ba dang 'byung ba'o //
translated: The five aggregates are appropriated by means of the unity of establishment and pleasure, i.e., by going to and arising.

original: khams kyi bye brag gi gnas nye bar len pa tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khams kyi bye brag gi gnas nye bar len pa tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the difference in the bases of appropriation due to the difference in the realms,

original: de la 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams na ni gnyi ga len to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams na ni gnyi ga len to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na ni ming dang gzugs gnyi ga grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas nye bar 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na ni ming dang gzugs gnyi ga grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas nye bar 'gro ste /
translated: In the desire realm and the form realm, both name and form are established and they approach each other as a single pleasure.

original: 'di ltar de na ming dang gzugs mdung khyim lta bur phan tshun brten te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de na ming dang gzugs mdung khyim lta bur phan tshun brten te 'byung ngo //

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs su rnam par smin pa mngon par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs su rnam par smin pa mngon par mi 'grub ste /

original: de'i phyir de ni ming zhes bya ba phung po bzhi po dag phan tshun grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pas nye bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni ming zhes bya ba phung po bzhi po dag phan tshun grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pas nye bar 'gro'o //
translated: Therefore, that realm is called name because the four aggregates approach each other as a single pleasure, being mutually established.

original: de na gzugs thams cad du thams cad med pa ma yin gyi bag chags @16b kyi dus nyid de gzugs rnam par smin pa'i dus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de na gzugs thams cad du thams cad med pa ma yin gyi bag chags @16b kyi dus nyid de gzugs rnam par smin pa'i dus ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that form does not exist in any way in that realm, but it is a latent seed, not the actualization of form.

original: de ltar gnas nye bar len pa bshad nas de'i mi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gnas nye bar len pa bshad nas de'i mi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having explained the appropriation of the abodes, in order to demonstrate the irrationality of that, he says:

original: len pa de la 'di'o zhes rig par mi nus pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: len pa de la 'di'o zhes rig par mi nus pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Since it is not possible to know that appropriation as this, it is not tenable that appropriation is the self.

original: gnas nye bar len pa de la 'di'o zhes rig par mi nus pas de'i phyir mi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas nye bar len pa de la 'di'o zhes rig par mi nus pas de'i phyir mi rigs pa zhes bya'o //

original: 'di'o zhes bya ba ni rang la 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di'o zhes bya ba ni rang la 'dzin pa lta bu'o //

original: len pa mi rigs pa bshad nas /
analyzed: len pa mi rigs pa bshad nas /

original: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa bshad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa bshad pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to explain the representation of the abode,

original: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe representation of the abode,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gnas pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de 'dir gnas kyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //

original: de'i mi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir de yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad par 'byung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i mi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir de yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad par 'byung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the unreasonableness of that, he says, ‚ÄúIt also arises without a delimited objective referent and aspect,‚Äù and so on.

original: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'di ltar dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad par 'byung ste ;
analyzed: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'di ltar dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad par 'byung ste ;
translated: That representation of the abode also arises without a delimited objective referent and aspect.

original: de'i phyir mi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be unreasonable.

original: yang mdo sde pas phyir brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang mdo sde pas phyir brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, the Sutra school responds with a counter-objection.

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba smras te /

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni dus thams cad du yul gyi rnam pa'i ngo bor 'byung bas de ni rang rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin na de ji ltar na de'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su mi gcod par 'gyur /

translated: In order to demonstrate the classification of the objects of confidence and so on, it says:

original: dngos po yod pa yon tan can nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa yon tan can nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: With regard to things that exist, have good qualities,üîΩand are the supreme refuge,üîΩthere is confidence, clarity, and desire.

original: yon tan can nam yon tan can ma yin pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: yon tan can nam yon tan can ma yin pa'ang rung ste /
translated: Whether they have good qualities or not,

original: dngos po yod pa gang yin pa de la yod pa nyid du yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa dang / dngos po yod pa yon tan dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la dad pa'i rnam pa dang / dngos po yod pa yon tan can thob par byed dam /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa gang yin pa de la yod pa nyid du yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa dang / dngos po yod pa yon tan dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la dad pa'i rnam pa dang / dngos po yod pa yon tan can thob par byed dam /
translated: Faith is the aspect of conviction in the existence of an existent thing.üîΩFaith is the aspect of confidence in the good qualities of an existent thing.

original: skyed nus pa gang yin pa de la 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: skyed nus pa gang yin pa de la 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Faith is the aspect of desire for the attainment or production of an existent thing that has good qualities.

original: dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the essential nature of clarity, he says:

original: sems dang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: sems dang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Clarity is a clarity of mind.

original: 'di ltar dang ba ni sems kyi rnyog pa dang mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang ba ni sems kyi rnyog pa dang mi mthun pa ste /
translated: Thus, clarity is incompatible with the turbidity of mind.

original: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan na nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i dri ma'i rnyog pa med pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan na nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i dri ma'i rnyog pa med pas /
translated: Therefore, when it is associated with that, the turbidity of the stains called the mental afflictions and the secondary mental afflictions does not exist.

original: sems dad pa la brten te dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dad pa la brten te dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind becomes clear on the basis of faith.

original: de lta bas na sems dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called clarity of mind.

original: sems kyi rnyog pa'i sgra ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags la bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rnyog pa'i sgra ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags la bya'o //
translated: The term turbidity of mind should be understood as the latent impressions of the mental afflictions.

original: 'di'i las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its action, he says:

original: de ni 'dun pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no zhes bya ba @29b smras so //
analyzed: de ni 'dun pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no zhes bya ba @29b smras so //
translated: It has the action of supporting aspiration.

original: 'di ni 'jug par 'dod pa bskyed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jug par 'dod pa bskyed pa'i las can te /
translated: It has the action of generating the desire to engage.

original: 'di ltar yid ches par gyur cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid ches par gyur cing /
translated: Thus, having become confident,

original: nus pa'i dngos po 'dod pa skyes nas 'jug pa la 'dun par byed do //
analyzed: nus pa'i dngos po 'dod pa skyes nas 'jug pa la 'dun par byed do //
translated: having generated the desire for the thing that is possible, one generates the aspiration to engage.

original: ngo tsha shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the intrinsic nature of conscience, he says:

original: ngo tsha shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te //
translated: Conscience is...

original: bdag dang chos la ltos nas kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa skye ba gang yin pa de ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang chos la ltos nas kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa skye ba gang yin pa de ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is generated by the fear of wrongdoing in relation to oneself and the teaching is called conscience.

original: kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /
translated: What kind of wrongdoing is it?

original: dam pa rnams kyis smad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis smad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: He says: that which is censured by the wise...

original: 'di ltar dam pa rnams kyis smad pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam pa rnams kyis smad pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is that which is censured by the wise and has an undesirable karmic maturation.

original: de'i phyir sdig pa nyid kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdig pa nyid kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, only evil is called wrongdoing.

original: byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung /
analyzed: byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung /
translated: Whether one does it or not,

original: kha na ma tho ba des sems zhum pa skye ba gang yin pa de 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba des sems zhum pa skye ba gang yin pa de 'dzin pa ste /
translated: one is ashamed of the offense and one's mind becomes depressed.

original: de nyid ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called shame.

original: 'di'i las bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te //
analyzed: 'di'i las bstan pa'i phyir / 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te //
translated: In order to demonstrate its action, he says:üîΩIt is the counteragent to the transgression of shamelessness.

original: nyes par spyod pa bzlog pa'i las can no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa bzlog pa'i las can no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It has the action of countering bad conduct.

original: khrel yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩkhrel yod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: khrel yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir / khrel yod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the intrinsic nature of shame, he says:

original: 'jig rten la ltos nas kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la ltos nas kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni khrel yod pa'o //
translated: Shame is the avoidance of what is objectionable out of consideration for the world.üîΩIt is the avoidance of what is objectionable out of consideration for the world.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'di ni smad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'di ni smad pa ste /
translated: Thus, in the world, this is despised.

original: bdag las 'di lta bu byed par rigs na 'jig rten smad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag las 'di lta bu byed par rigs na 'jig rten smad par 'gyur te /
translated: It is not proper for me to do such an action, because it is despised by the world.

original: de'i phyir mi snyan pa'i 'jigs pas kha na ma tho ba la 'dzem mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi snyan pa'i 'jigs pas kha na ma tho ba la 'dzem mo //
translated: Therefore, one avoids what is objectionable out of fear of public disgrace.

original: smad pa ni bshung ba'o //
analyzed: smad pa ni bshung ba'o //
translated: Despised means reproached.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa ni mi snyan pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa ni mi snyan pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The unmetrical is called the unpleasant sound.

original: las bstan pa'i phyir 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: las bstan pa'i phyir 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to teach the action, he says, ‚Äúthis‚Äù and so on.

original: don de ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: don de ni brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The meaning of this is just the understanding of the conventional.

original: ma chags pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ma chags pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúnon-attachment‚Äù and so on.

original: chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni ma chags pa'o //
translated: That which is the antidote to attachment is non-attachment.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is called attachment?

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúattachment is called‚Äù and so on.

original: 'khor ba dang / 'khor ba'i yo byad la chags pa dang / smon pa gang yin pa de chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / 'khor ba'i yo byad la chags pa dang / smon pa gang yin pa de chags pa'o //
translated: That which is attachment to cyclic existence and the equipment of cyclic existence, and the aspiration for it, is attachment.

original: de'i gnyen po ni ma chags pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir 'khor ba dang de'i yo byad glang po che dang rta la sogs pa la ma chags pa dang / mi phyogs pa dang mi @30a * //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni ma chags pa'o // de'i phyir 'khor ba dang de'i yo byad glang po che dang rta la sogs pa la ma chags pa dang / mi phyogs pa dang mi @30a * //
translated: The antidote to that is non-attachment.üîΩTherefore, non-attachment to cyclic existence and its equipment, such as elephants, horses, and so on, is non-attachment, non-direction, non-desire, and non-aspiration.

original: 'dod pa dang mi smon pa ni ma chags pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi smon pa ni ma chags pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is taught.

original: zhe sdang med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThe wise are not at all angry‚Äù is stated to illustrate the absence of anger.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the absence of hatred, he says:üîΩAbsence of hatred is the antidote to hatred.

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur ba'i chos byams pa'i ngo bo nyid ni zhe sdang med pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur ba'i chos byams pa'i ngo bo nyid ni zhe sdang med pa'o //
translated: The absence of hatred is the nature of love, which is the antidote to hatred.

original: zhe sdang nyid gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: zhe sdang nyid gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is hatred?

original: zhe sdang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúHatred is the desire to harm,‚Äù etc.

original: gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams dang / sdug bsngal rnams dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dug dang / tsher ma la sogs pa la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams dang / sdug bsngal rnams dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dug dang / tsher ma la sogs pa la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Hatred is the desire to harm sentient beings who are harmful, suffering, and the causes of suffering, such as poison, thorns, etc.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pas sems can rnams dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnam pa kun nas mnar sems pa med pa'i ngo bor blta'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pas sems can rnams dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnam pa kun nas mnar sems pa med pa'i ngo bor blta'o //
translated: Since the absence of hatred is the antidote to hatred, it should be seen as the nature of the absence of the desire to harm sentient beings, suffering, and the causes of suffering.

original: las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its action, he says:

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: This also is the basis for patience, etc.

original: don de ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: don de ni brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The meaning of this is self-evident.

original: gti mug med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gti mug med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate non-delusion, he says:

original: gti mug med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Non-delusion is the antidote to delusion.

original: gti mug gi gnyen por gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos gang yin pa de ni 'dir gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi gnyen por gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos gang yin pa de ni 'dir gti mug med pa'o //
translated: That which is the antidote to delusion, the reality of the realization of things as they are in actuality, is here non-delusion.

original: gti mug nyid gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: gti mug nyid gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is delusion itself?

original: gti mug ni las dang 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gti mug ni las dang 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says: Delusion is ignorance of action, result, etc.

original: las la sogs pa mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni gti mug go //
analyzed: las la sogs pa mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni gti mug go //
translated: That which is ignorance of action, etc. is delusion.

original: gti mug med pa ni de'i gnyen po yin pas /
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni de'i gnyen po yin pas /
translated: Non-delusion is its antidote.

original: bden pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as the reality of the realization of the truths, etc.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni las ston te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni las ston te /
translated: This is taught by the verse beginning with ‚Äúthis‚Äù and so on.

original: don ni brda phrad par zad do //üîΩbrtson 'grus kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don ni brda phrad par zad do // brtson 'grus kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning is exhausted in the communication.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the intrinsic reality of effort, he says:

original: brtson 'grus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Effort is the antidote to laziness.

original: le lo'i gnyen por gyur pa dge ba'i las la sems spro ba gang yin pa de brtson 'grus yin gyi /
analyzed: le lo'i gnyen por gyur pa dge ba'i las la sems spro ba gang yin pa de brtson 'grus yin gyi /
translated: Effort is the delight of mind in virtuous action, which is the antidote to laziness.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi las la spro ba ni brtson 'grus ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi las la spro ba ni brtson 'grus ma yin te /
translated: Delight in defiled action is not effort.

original: gang nyon mongs pa can gyi las la spro ba ni smad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa can gyi las la spro ba ni smad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because delight in defiled action is reprehensible,

original: le lo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: le lo nyid yin gyi /
translated: it is laziness,

original: brtson 'grus ma yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ma yin no //
translated: not effort.

original: smad pa'i dngos po la chags pa'i phyir de yang le lo nyid do //
analyzed: smad pa'i dngos po la chags pa'i phyir de yang le lo nyid do //
translated: And because it is attachment to a reprehensible thing, it is also laziness.

original: de'i phyir le lo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir le lo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, laziness is of two kinds:

original: snyom las kyi mtshan nyid dang nyon mongs pa can la spro ba'o //
analyzed: snyom las kyi mtshan nyid dang nyon mongs pa can la spro ba'o //
translated: the characteristic of indolence and delight in defiled things.

original: las bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni @30b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: las bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni @30b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate its action, he says, it is the basis of the non-arising of virtue, etc.

original: 'di ni dge ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the basis of the non-arising of virtue that has not yet arisen and the basis of the degeneration of virtue that has already arisen.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni gang yin snyam pa la shin tu sbyangs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te gnas ngan len gyi gnyen por gyur pa lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid gang yin pa de shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni gang yin snyam pa la shin tu sbyangs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te gnas ngan len gyi gnyen por gyur pa lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid gang yin pa de shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúPliancy is a fitness of the body and mind that acts as an antidote to indisposition.‚Äù

original: gnas ngan len de ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /üîΩgnas ngan len ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len de ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la / gnas ngan len ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: What is indisposition?

original: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid gnas ngan len zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid gnas ngan len zhes bya'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIndisposition is a lack of fitness of the body and mind.‚Äù

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: Or, the seeds of afflicted phenomena are indisposition.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la de med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la de med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Why is that? He says, ‚ÄúWhen that is absent, there is pliancy.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon med par gyur na shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon med par gyur na shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the seeds of afflicted phenomena are absent, there is pliancy.

original: de'i phyir de yang gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang gnas ngan len to //
translated: Therefore, that is also indisposition.

original: lus las su rung ba nyid gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: lus las su rung ba nyid gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is fitness of the body?

original: de la lus las su rung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de la lus las su rung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The passage beginning Physical pliancy explains the first two.

original: lus rang gi dgos pa rnams la ldang ba yang ba gang las byung ba de lus las su rung ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus rang gi dgos pa rnams la ldang ba yang ba gang las byung ba de lus las su rung ba nyid ces bya'o //

original: ldang ba yang ba zhes bya ba la bde ba'o //
analyzed: ldang ba yang ba zhes bya ba la bde ba'o //

analyzed: sems las su rung ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Mental pliancy is the lightness and flexibility of the mind that comes from the elimination of the obstruction to the mind's natural functions.üîΩLightness is the quality of being light, and flexibility is the quality of being able to focus on an object of meditation.

original: sems las su rung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The passage beginning When the mind is pliant explains the third.üîΩThe passage beginning When the mind is pliant explains the third.

original: yang dag pa yid la byed pa la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i sems gang yin pa de'i sim pa dang yang ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang yin pa de sems las su rung ba nyid do //üîΩsim pa ni bde ba'o //üîΩyang ba ni gsal ba'o //

translated: Pliancy is a mental factor that is the cause of the mind's suppleness and flexibility.üîΩSuppleness is the quality of being supple, and flexibility is the quality of being able to focus on an object of meditation.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la de dang ldan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la de dang ldan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Why is it called pliancy?

original: 'di ltar sems las byung ba de dang ldan na dmigs pa la sems 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems las byung ba de dang ldan na dmigs pa la sems 'jug ste /
translated: Because when you have it, the mind engages its object.

original: de'i phyir de sems las su rung ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de sems las su rung ba nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúpliancy of mind.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan shin tu sbyangs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dir ni sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan shin tu sbyangs pa yin na /
translated: Here, if pliancy is a factor of mind,

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes ji skad du bya zhe na /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes ji skad du bya zhe na /
translated: how can it be called ‚Äúpliancy of the body‚Äù?

original: lus kyi reg bya'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: lus kyi reg bya'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: khong khro ba gang yin snyam pa la khong khro ba ni sems can kun la kun nas mnar sems pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /üîΩsems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa dang / sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis non na sems can rnams la bsad pa dad bcing ba la sogs @33a * //
analyzed: khong khro ba gang yin snyam pa la khong khro ba ni sems can kun la kun nas mnar sems pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te / sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa dang / sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis non na sems can rnams la bsad pa dad bcing ba la sogs @33a * //
translated: What is anger? It is the complete mental affliction of all sentient beings.üîΩIt is the complete mental affliction of sentient beings, the harshness of mind toward sentient beings,

analyzed: 'di'i las bstan pa'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

analyzed: de dgrol ba'i phyir reg pa ni bde ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: g-yo gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: g-yo gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is deceit?

original: g-yo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: g-yo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, Deceit is a crookedness of mind.

translated: He says, A method for concealing one‚Äôs faults.

translated: It is a method for concealing one‚Äôs faults by whatever means one confuses others.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan @38a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan @38a * //
translated: Why does one confuse others?

original: mgo rmongs par byed pa zhes snyam pa la /
analyzed: mgo rmongs par byed pa zhes snyam pa la /
translated: He says,

analyzed: de yang gzhan nas gzhan du bsgyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: gzhan nas gzhan du bsgyur ba dang / gtam rlung bskur ba dang / gsal bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de gzhan mgo rmongs par byed pa'o //

translated: Changing from one thing to another,  spreading rumors, and not clarifying are all ways of confusing others.

original: gzhan nas gzhan du bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni dris na gzhan gyis lan 'debs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan nas gzhan du bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni dris na gzhan gyis lan 'debs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Changing from one thing to another means that when asked a question, one answers with something else.

original: gtam rlung bskur zhes bya ba ni gtam de gzhan du bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gtam rlung bskur zhes bya ba ni gtam de gzhan du bsgyur ba'o //

original: gsal bar mi byed ces bya ba ni ngas byas so zhes nog nog po'i tshul du smra ba'o //
analyzed: gsal bar mi byed ces bya ba ni ngas byas so zhes nog nog po'i tshul du smra ba'o //
translated: Not clarifying means that one speaks in a roundabout way, saying, I did this.

original: de ni 'di skad du ci dris kyang bdag gi nyes pa mi smra ba dang / gsal por mi smra ba'i tshul du byed pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ci dris kyang bdag gi nyes pa mi smra ba dang / gsal por mi smra ba'i tshul du byed pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is taught as follows: Whatever is asked, one does not speak about one's own faults, and one does not speak clearly.

original: 'chab pa dang 'di'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'chab pa dang 'di'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the difference between concealment and this, he says:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: 'di ltar g-yo ni gtam rlung bskur ba dang / gsal bar mi byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar g-yo ni gtam rlung bskur ba dang / gsal bar mi byed pa yin gyi /

original: gcig tu 'chab par mi byed de /
analyzed: gcig tu 'chab par mi byed de /
translated: It is not the concealment of one's faults in a straightforward manner.

original: de'i phyir de 'chab pa dang tha dad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'chab pa dang tha dad do //
translated: Therefore, it is different from concealment.

original: 'chab pa ni 'di ltar gsal por mkhyud par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni 'di ltar gsal por mkhyud par byed kyi /
translated: Concealment is the concealment of one's faults in a straightforward manner.

original: thabs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thabs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not through a skillful means.

original: zur gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thabs kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: zur gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thabs kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: It is not through an indirect means. The meaning of not through a skillful means is the same as not through an indirect means.

original: 'di'i brtags pa'i yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i brtags pa'i yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the existence of that which is imagined, he says:

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: This refers to the concealment of one's faults through flattery and not through clarity.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags nas chags pa dang gti mug de gnyis kyi rang gi nyes pa mkhyud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags nas chags pa dang gti mug de gnyis kyi rang gi nyes pa mkhyud pa'i phyir /
translated: Through attachment and delusion, one conceals one's faults out of excessive attachment to gain and honor.
